According to LMC records, around 1,600 metric tonnes of waste is generated daily in LucknowAccording to LMC records, around 1,600 metric tonnes of waste is generated daily in the city. Of this, 60% (960 tonnes) is collected from the doorsteps of residents. The corporation has installed over 450 trash cans with collective storage of 480 metric tonnes in different localities. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.The remaining 160 metric tonnes is disposed of in the open, mostly on roadsides and vacant plots. Since collection of waste lying in open and its transfer to solid waste treatment plant is not done timely, unattended garbage piles have become a common sight in many parts of Lucknow. As per Swachh Bharat Mission guidelines, there should be a dumpster at every 500 metres but since there are not enough bins, LMC has put up a trash collector container at every 1.5-2 km. TOI reality check also found that there are several residential areas, like New Hyderabad, where no bin has been set up. People throw garbage in the open which, if not collected timely, continues to rot and often ends up chocking drains. Latest CommentThis is the problem on one hand Yogi shouts swacchta swacchta and this is the state of affairs in the state capital let alone other cities. Horrible management, dud CM.Ankit PantSee All CommentsAdd commentAt Jopling Road, TOI found a trash container but it was brimming with garbage. “We have no other option but to dump waste in the open as LMC workers don’t remove garbage from the container daily,” said Ankit Dubey, a resident of the area. LMC environment engineer Pankaj Bhusan said, “We are planning to install more bins and have issued directions for regular collection from every area. We have also asked a private company hired for door-to-door garbage collection to increase its coverage area. Currently, the agency covers only 60% of total 5.48 lakh households.”

column2: Uttar Pradesh government sacks Hathras ADM over facebook post against Yogi Adityanath
column3: LUCKNOW: The state government has sacked Hathras additional district magistrate Ashok Kumar Shukla, a PCS officer, for putting up a post on social media against chief minister Yogi Adityanath in 2018 and for having illegally allocated government land to a resident of Hardoi when he was posted as SDM there in 2016. Action was also taken against another PCS officer, Ashok Kumar Lal, who was sacked after two charges of corruption against him were found true. Four more allegations against him are under investigation. Until now, Lal was under suspension. In the case of Shukla, the first charge included putting up a social media post which “created a negative image of the government district administration”. Officer faces two chargesNEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.On February 5, 2018, when Shukla was SDM Amethi, he reportedly wrote on his Facebook wall: “In the name of a meeting yesterday, I sat from 2 pm to 12.40 am. Most of your officers are falling sick Yogi ji.” The government said that Shukla’s meeting was not scheduled from 2pm, as claimed, but from 4pm. The time the meeting ended was also incorrectly stated by him, the report against the officer says. Shukla’s defence that his personal phone was at home and that the post was made by his minor daughter did not hold weight with the government which said that to access Facebook a password is needed which is only with the specific user. Latest CommentWrong misleadind and motivated heading.Rajeev SrivastavaSee All CommentsAdd commentThe other charge against Shukla was that as SDM Hardoi, he had allocated government land illegally to a resident, Hamidullah, in 2016. After a complaint against him, the then DM Hardoi carried out an inquiry in which it was found that Shukla could not justify how government land was transferred in someone’s name. He also did not mention what documentary proof he had used to allow this transfer or justify the provisions under which Hamidullah was declared as land owner. Citing that both actions were in violation of the Conduct Rules, 1956, government has dismissed Shukla from service.

column2: When last Hyderabad Nizam donated Rs 1 lakh to BHU in 1939
column3: LUCKNOW: While Banaras Hindu University grapples with protests over a Muslim professor teaching Sanskrit, exactly 80 years ago the last Nizam of Hyderabad displayed his magnanimity by making a generous donation of Rs 1 lakh to the university, which is equivalent to Rs 5 crore now. In 1939, the Nizam Mir Osman Ali Khan issued a farman to release the money from his exchequer. “Farman of Nizam the VII dated 15th Ziqada, 1357 H/ 7th January, 1939. It is ordered to sanction rupees one lakh to Banaras Hindu University under the circumstances mentioned by the council in its memorandum,” read the farman (order) in Urdu, a copy of which is maintained by his kin. Speaking to TOI from Hyderabad on Friday, Nizam’s grandson Najaf Ali Khan said his grandfather, who was a secular person, had also donated money for maintenance, upkeep and repair of at least 20 temples. “Pandit Madan Mohan Malviya and Maulana Abul Kalam Azad had approached my grandfather for donation for BHU and Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) respectively around the same time in 1939,” said Khan. “The Nizam donated Rs 1 lakh to BHU and Rs 50,000 to AMU. This shows that he was there for everybody irrespective of caste or religion,” he added. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“Not just these two universities, he donated to several universities across the country and outside India. He also donated to the National Defence Fund and helped the British with funds and 27 aircraft during World War II,” said Khan. While Khan has a copy of the farman, the original document is stored at the Telangana State Archives. Top CommentWhat really happened:Malviya begged Nizam for funds to start #BHUNizam threw his shoe at Malviya saying- "How dare you ask me for funds for a Hindu university. Get out".Malvi...Read MorePreetiSee All CommentsAdd commentThe Nizam’s kin also expressed disappointment on the students’ protest against Professor Firoz Khan. “This should not have happened. India is a land of syncretic culture. Such upheavals are not good for the country’s prosperity,” he said. “This should not have happened. India is a land of syncretic culture. Such upheavals are not good for the country’s prosperity,” he said. The student protest began against Prof Firoz Khan on November 7.

column2: Lucknow: 'BJP won Cantonment, but turnout big concern'
column3: LUCKNOW: Union home minister and Lucknow MP Rajnath Singh on Friday expressed concern over low voter turnout in Lucknow Cantonment assembly bypoll though BJP candidate Suresh Tewari won the seat by a margin of 35,000 votes. The voter turnout in Lucknow Cantonment bypoll was 28.77%, which was the lowest since 1991 when polling percentage was 28.42. The bypoll was held on October 21. Addressing party workers in Cantonment, Singh said he was initially concerned on learning about the low turnout on the polling day but "thankfully, Suresh Tewari sailed through". He exhorted party workers to make efforts to ensure at least 50% voter turnout in future elections. During an election rally in Lucknow Cantt, chief minister Yogi Adityanath had also asked BJP workers not to become overconfident and ensure that more people come out to vote in favour of the BJP candidate. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.The home minister said BJP does what it says. "We have always stuck to our ideology and never deviated from it. We have won the confidence of the people. Since the abrogation of Article 370 no one has died in police firing in Jammu and Kashmir." Rajnath also reviewed the progress of ongoing development projects in the city. These include construction of additional platforms at Charbagh railway station, satellite station in Alamnagar, expansion of Lucknow airport terminal, sewage treatment plant, outer ring road, widening of Lucknow-Sultanpur highway and works at Gomtinagar railway station.

column2: Uttar Pradesh: Two killed, one injured as drunk youths ram bike into gate
column3: LUCKNOW: Two youths died after one of them lost control over a motorcycle and it crashed into the gate of a doctor's home in Alambagh early Friday morning. Police said the deceased - Gopal Rawat (26) and Rahul Rawat (21) - were heavily drunk and were returning from a party. Another youth Aman Rawat (26) who was riding pillion along with Gopal and Rahul sustained serious injuries and is undergoing treatment at King George's Medical University (KGMU). The bike belonged to Rahul and he was driving the two-wheeler. Police said the accident occurred around 2am when the three Para residents were returning after attending a wedding in Kakori. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Station house officer (Alambagh) AK Shahi said, "The three youths were inebriated and were not wearing helmets. Their bike crashed into the gate of a house owned by Dr Ranjeet Singh in Gadhi Kanura locality." While Gopal died on the spot, Aman and Rahul where rushed to KGMU where the latter was announced brought dead.  "Aman is undergoing treatment, but is yet to gain consciousness," the SHO added. Gopal was a painter by profession, while the other two worked as carpenters.

column2: 4 sell pre-activated SIM cards, held
column3: GHAZIABAD: Four persons were arrested on Saturday for allegedly selling pre-activated mobile SIM cards to people. Police said the arrests were made during a raid on 100-odd mobile shops across the city. Around 900 mobile phones were found to be without relevant documents and the police have seized those. SP (city) Manish Mishra said that the investigations were on to find out how many people had bought such pre-activated SIM cards. “Many people buy them without giving any address and identity proof,” he said. “Four mobile shop owners were arrested after the raid and they gave us false information about the phones,” he added. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.The SP (city) said that many criminals have told the police that they used pre-activated SIM cards to commit crimes. “We selected 100-odd mobile shops across the city and conducted a raid on those on Saturday,” SP city said.

column2: When Lucknowites played antakshari
column3: Members of an organisation, which is a business platform for young entrepreneurs in the city, recently met for a musical get-together. Dressed mostly in traditional wear, the members attended the do with their family. Saurabh Agarwal, one of the founder members of the organisation, was spotted looking after the arrangements, who made sure that everything was just perfect. (L) Gaurav (R) Kanav Aroura and Deepesh Kishnani (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) (L) Gaurav (R) Kanav Aroura and Deepesh Kishnani (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) The highlight of the evening was the musical dumb charades antakshari which the members played being divided into two teams. In the game, a member of a team had to pick a chit and sing a song with the word written on it. Songs like 'Yeh Chand Sa Raushan Chehra', 'Dhal Gaya Din' and 'Kangna Tera Ni' were sung while playing these games. column2: Truck hits car, tries to mow down lone Unnao case witness
column3: LUCKNOW: An attempt was allegedly made on the life of Awadesh Pratap Singh, the lone eyewitness in Unnao rape survivor’s accident case, in Ajgain police station area of Unnao district on Friday. Lodging an FIR on Saturday, Singh said he was travelling in a car with Rajesh Kumar, the surety holder of the survivor’s uncle, at 2.30pm when a truck hit his vehicle from the right side. “The impact of the crash was so intense that my vehicle mounted over the Unnao-Kanpur highway divider in front of an eatery. The truck driver tried to hit our car again but we managed to escape,” Singh said. He said they saw a youth fleeing the spot and found that the registration number plate of the truck had also been tampered with. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Singh said the modus operandi of the attackers was similar to the car crash involving Unnao rape survivor on July 28. Awadesh told TOI he was not provided security despite a Supreme Court order in this regard. Station officer, Ajgain, Ajay Verma said an FIR of attempt to murder had been lodged and a probe was underway. Top Commentthis govt must be dismissedRewardingSee All CommentsAdd commentOn July 28, the Unnao rape survivor, her family members and lawyer were critically injured when a truck crashed into their car on NH-31. Her two aunts, who were in the car, died in the accident. Later, the case was taken over by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI). The central investigating agency also filed a chargesheet in the case on October 12 dropping murder charge against expelled BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar.

column2: Governors deciding who will form government: Akhilesh Yadav
column3: LUCKNOW: Taking a swipe at the BJP over political developments in Maharashtra, Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav on Saturday said it seems that governors are deciding who will form government in states. Latest CommentOpponents start blaming and making stories without any evidence. Thank god there is SC.Sunil KumarSee All CommentsAdd comment“Ab toh lagta hai, jiska governor, usi ki sarkar (It seems that governors decide the government),” Akhilesh tweeted. The comment came after BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis, in a surprise move, took oath as Maharashtra chief minister even as Shiv Sena, NCP and Congress were poised to form government till Friday evening. SkipSP spokesman Rajendra Chaudhary said: “Political situation in Maharashtra exposes BJP’s undemocratic and unfair politics. This is not a good sign. They held Cabinet meet at midnight and withdrew President’s rule early morning. This is not the right way.” UP Congress president Ajay Kumar Lallu said, “The government formation in Maharashtra is unconstitutional. Autocratic BJP has played with principles of democracy. This proved BJP can go to any extent to remain in power.” A senior leader of BSP said: “BJP is killing democracy. There is a limit to which one can go to usurp power. BJP has no ethics. In states, where BJP was in minority, it used unfair means to snatch power. It’s clear the party will stop at nothing to grab power.” Rubbishing opposition’s allegations, BJP state chief Swatantra Dev Singh said, “We are confident that the Fadnavis government will work for welfare of people and will take Maharashtra to greater heights of prosperity.”

column2: ‘No $5 trillion economy sans women’s support’
column3: LUCKNOW: Defence minister Rajnath Singh said the country cannot achieve the target of becoming a $5 trillion economy just with men and also needs the contribution of the other half of country, that is, the women, for it. “Women have made major contributions in various fields. Despite several challenges they face, women have become CEOs of several multinational companies and have excelled in other fields like sports,” Singh said, addressing an event organised by FICCI Ladies Organisation (FLO) on Saturday. Giving the example of Vedic philosophers like Maitreyi, Gargi etc, Singh said, “India has always respected its women since Vedic times and if women in those days could make a name for themselves, it’s hard to understand what stopped women from achieving their goals these days.” Singh also rued the fact that mothers have stopped telling stories to their children. “Just bringing up children is not enough. Mothers and sisters need to educate them. Story telling is part of that education,” he said. The nation is in safe hands and the decisive leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi had improved India’s image internationally. “Respect for India has gone up and nobody now thinks us to be weak. While other countries are suffering from economic slowdown, India is not as badly affected and investors consider India as a good option,” he added. The minister, who is on a two-day visit to his Lok Sabha constituency, also addressed BJP workers on Saturday evening. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.‘Pak financially weak, begging’Hitting out against Pakistan, defence minister Rajnath Singh said the neighbouring country has become financially weak and is forced to beg before the world. “All countries know where terror is being bred and even China has asked all nations to take action against terrorism,” he said. ‘Many firms keen to invest’Rajnath Singh said he received enthusiastic response to the country’s defence corridors, one coming up in UP and the other in Tamil Nadu. “I travelled to many countries and several companies expressed desire to set up units in the defence corridors we are setting up. We are expecting 500 to 1,000 companies to attend the five-day February 2020 Defence Expo. Many have expressed interest in identifying land when they are here,” he said.

column2: ‘Prahari’ from IIT-Kanpur can take down rogue drones
column3: KANPUR: A team of IITians in Kanpur have developed a drone named ‘Prahari’ which is capable of carrying a load of about 4-5 kg and can also patrol sensitive zone for three hours continuously. This is no an ordinary drone but an autonomous system (drone) consisting of an unmanned helicopter with drone catching net. ‘Prahari’ is unique in this way that it can chase, outrun and capture the rogue drone. The drone is also equipped with an advanced autopilot system, developed at IIT-Kanpur which is also capable of handling the sudden changes in weight and inertia (of this drone) while capturing the rogue drone. This system has been developed by Prof Abhishek and Prof Mangal Kothari of the department of aerospace engineering and their team of students. Latest CommentGood and helpful postANKIT VERMASee All CommentsAdd commentThe drone, specially designed for border surveillance and national security, could be very handy for the armed forces for maintaining vigilance along the border areas and also for capturing the rogue drones which pose a serious threat to national security. Recently, HRD minister Ramesh Pokhriyal ‘Nishank’ had shared the video of this drone on Twitter and praised IIT-Kanpur for having developed this capability which is unique in the country. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Talking to TOI, associate professor Abhishek said, “This drone can be used for a wide range of applications, ranging from surveillance, crowd monitoring, crowd control, delivery of emergency supplies, precision agriculture, hostage situations, chemical and nuclear agent detection. Not only this, it can outrun the rogue drone and can capture it in its nets. This way, not only the rogue drone is physically captured but also vital information can be extracted from it.

column2: BSP sacks former MP, 3 others for indiscipline
column3: LUCKNOW: Former MP and five-time MLA Ram Prasad Chaudhary was expelled by BSP on Saturday for indiscipline and anti-party activities. The party also suspended three former MLAs from Basti, Rajendra Chaudhary, Doodh Ram and Jitendra Kumar, alias Nandu Chaudhary. BSP’s Basti district president Sanjay Dhusia said that the quartet had been involved in anti-party activities for the past several months and had been given several warnings. “However, they were undeterred and have been expelled from the party with immediate effect,” he said. Amid speculation that they would join SP, Ram Prasad Chaudhary, a former minister in the Mayawati government, told TOI that he had not yet made up his mind about it. “The party chief is upset over something which is not clear to us. I resigned from the party on Saturday even as they served me an expulsion notice. I will continue in politics but have not decided yet which party to join,” he said. Latest CommentBSP alongside with Congress are becoming irrelevant in UP politics. BJP snd SP are serious contenders of the vacuum left by Congress and BSP in UPMahendra Vir SaxenaSee All CommentsAdd commentThe former MP is a prominent Kurmi leader in Basti and sources said that the possibility of him joining Samajwadi Party was strong since SP lacked a Kurmi leader in the area. “The local SP leader in Basti left the party and contested the 2019 Lok Sabha elections from Congress. SP needs a Kurmi leader there and therefore can be keen to have Chaudhary on board,” said a BSP member. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Recently, BSP lost its two-time MLC and former finance minister K K Gautam to SP. Other prominent members who left BSP to join SP include former MLA Kamlesh Diwakar and Indrajit Saroj in 2017.

column2: Royal Bengal tiger treks 150km from Panna, spotted in Bundelkhand
column3: JHANSI: Panic gripped the inhabitants of the villages on Mahoba-Hamirpur border in UP when they spotted a tiger in the fields on Friday afternoon. A resident of Gheodi village clicked the big cat and informed police and the local administration. Forest department officials swiftly rushed to the spot and set up a camp in the village and launched surveillance to ensure safety of villagers. Chief conservator of forests, Bundelkhand range, Pinaki Singh, told TOI, “It’s a Royal Bengal tiger which trekked more than 150km from Panna tiger reserve along the banks of Ken river. It’s our national animal and comes under Schedule I of Wildlife Protection Act 1972. Our team is camping here to rescue the tiger and take it back to the sanctuary. We have arranged cages from Kanpur for the rescue operation. This is first time that a Royal Bengal tiger has ventured in this area.” “The pugmarks lifted from the agricultural fields and the photos, though taken from a distance, suggest that it’s a sub-adult tiger, which may have just weaned off from its mother. And, in the process of survival and developing a territory, it has strayed a considerable distance. Generally, big cats like tiger move along river banks,” Singh added. “We have identified around seven villages in the vicinity of the spot where the tiger was last spotted and are focusing all our efforts there. We are carrying out activities like sensitization of locals, spreading awareness regarding tiger and its behaviour, dos and don’ts when a tiger is sighted, whom to inform about a direct or indirect sighting of a tiger,” Singh added. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.

column2: This Mahotsava, choppers to take you around Lucknow
column3: LUCKNOW: Get ready to experience the scenic beauty of your landscape in 2020. Wondering how? For the first time in Lucknow Mahotsav scheduled in January, UP Tourism would organise a helicopter joyride for visitors. The Heli ride will start from Ambedkar Park, Hussainabad Heritage Zone, to Janeshwar Mishra Park and Hazratganj. The trial for chopper ride will begin in January. Private helicopter companies will be roped in through tender system for Mahotsav. In 2016 too, UP Tourism had sent a proposal for joyride but was not approved by the district administration. However, this year, the administration has given its nod and the ride would be a part of the adventure games section at the event. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“The proposal was sent long back but due to some reason, we couldn’t start it. Tickets for the services will be available at Mahotsav counter itself. Price will vary from Rs 2,500 to Rs 3,000 per person,” said Anupam Srivastava, regional tourism officer (UP Tourism) and secretary of Lucknow Mahotsav Committee. “The proposed helipad will be constructed near Ramabai Ambedkar Sthal or Smriti Upvan. However, if the work is not completed on time, we will go for a temporary helipad for the event,” he added. “Duration would be 10 minutes per ride, 10-15 rounds a day depending on the demand. While only six people at a time will be able to take the chopper,” he further said.

column2: Bailout package for embattled PCL staff
column3: LUCKNOW: The Uttar Pradesh government on Saturday announced a bailout package for embattled staff of the power corporation, which is embroiled in a row over Rs 2,600-crore provident fund trapped in a bankrupt private firm Dewan Housing Financial Limited (DHFL). The announcement came late evening through a government order (GO) by UP power secretary Arvind Kumar. According to the GO, the government, will continue to explore legal remedy — through an intervener writ filed in Bombay High Court in the Reliance Nippon Assets versus DHFL case — to seek return of funds. In case the procedure hits a wall, the UPPCL will first be asked to mobilise funds through its sources. If the corporation is unable to generate that money, the Uttar Pradesh government will offer an interest-free bailout package to the corporation. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“The bailout money will be used to disburse PF amount invested by employees,” the order said. Latest Commentwhy any bailout?RewardingSee All CommentsAdd commentUP energy minister Shrikant Sharma, confirmed the development, saying that interest of employees is paramount and the department, after taking due assistance from attorneys, took the decision. About 45,000 Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation employees, who have formed a Vidyut Karamchari Sanyukt Sangharsh Samiti, announced a 2-day strike to demand return of their provident fund.

column2: Allahabad high court: Why engage contractual staff on regular posts?
column3: Lucknow: The Lucknow bench of Allahabad High court has asked the state government to explain why it was engaging contractual employees against regular sanctioned posts through service providers and restrained it from continuing the practice till then. The court posted the matter on November 27 for next hearing. While seeking explanation from the state government, the bench, in an interim direction refrained the respondent from engaging service providers to provide contractual employees against regular sanctioned posts. A bench of Justice M N Bhandari and Justice V K Srivastava passed the order on a petition filed by a service provider firm M/s RMS Technosolutions Pvt Ltd. The petitioner challenged the October 25, 2019 order of state government cancelling its registration. Opposing the plea, state government said it had not just cancelled registration of petitioner but of all service provider firms to formulate a proper scheme to avoid any unfairness in engaging persons. In course of hearing, the court referred to the verdict rendered by the Supreme Court on petition of one Uma Devi 13 years ago, in which it had directed the Karnataka government not to indulge in ad hocism and rather had suggested to do away with it within six months. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.The bench said, “Recently, the apex court has made a comment over such arrangements saying government should not run through contractual employees. While adjudicating issue prayed in the writ petition, we take cognizance of the arrangement made by the State of Uttar Pradesh. Instead of filling the post on regular basis, it is managed through contractual service through the persons sent by the service provider.” The bench said, “The state government is directed to explain if it is permissible after SC judgment in the case of Uma Devi in 2013 and why the sanctioned posts are not being filled on regular basis.”

column2: Six years on, no daily garbage collection in 40% homes in Lucknow
column3: LUCKNOW: Six years after the Lucknow Municipal Corporation (LMC) introduced door-to-door garbage collection in the city, the agency roped in for the task has been able to cover only 60% of the households, leaving tonnes of waste unattended. After a young activist stood amid rotting garbage in Daliganj in protest when his complaints to LMC to clean the area fell on deaf ears, TOI conducted a reality check on Friday and found unattended garbage piles in many parts of the city. In the second part of the series on Saturday, TOI highlighted the lack of dumpsters on roadsides. As per LMC records, around 960 metric tonnes of garbage is generated daily in 5.48 lakh households in the city but the private agency assigned the task of door-to-door collection covers 3.56 lakh household which generate 576 metric tonnes of waste every day. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.As a result, 384 metric tonnes of garbage generated from 1.92lakh households remains uncollected. Since LMC has not placed the required number of dumpsters, as prescribed in Swachch Bharat Mission guidelines, nearly 160 metric tonnes of waste is thrown in the open. Residents of Yahiyaganj, Chowk, Raqabganj, Jankipuram Extension and Gomtinagar Extension claimed no agency was collecting garbage from their doorsteps. Rajat Yadav, a resident of Yahiyaganj, said: "We are forced to throw garbage on roads as there is door-to-door collection facility here." Disha Malhotra of Jankipurma said sanitation workers collected garbage only from select areas. "Door-to-door collection is done only for 2-3 a week," said Ajay Singh, a resident of Mahanagar. Additional municipal commissioner Amit Singh said, "We have instructed all zonal officials to prepare a progress report and ask the government to direct the private agency to improve door-to-door collection or else its payment will be stopped." An official of the private agency claimed that they have improved the services and are now covering 80% and not 60% as claimed by the LMC. "We will cover the entire city by January next year," he said.

column2: Buy one smart card and get Metro rides across UP
column3: LUCKNOW: Metro commuters using smart cards will be able to travel seamlessly in all Metros across Uttar Pradesh, besides using the chip-based payment device for availing a host of other facilities. According to Uttar Pradesh Metro Rail Corporation (UPMRC) officials, its smart card will be functional in all the Metro projects coming up in cities like Meerut, Agra, Kanpur, Varanasi and Gorakhpur and an integrated system will be put in place for the same. Not only travelling, UPMRC is also planning to allow smart cards for making payments for facilities like food joints, convenience stores and feeder service provided by the corporation at their stations. UPMRC managing director Kumar Keshav said, "The smart cards can be recharged from any city in UP having Metro service. Every data related to a smart card will be shared on one platform, so it can become easy for commuters as well as for us to keep track of smart card sales and their recharges." NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.At present, smart card holders get a 10% discount on every ride. Smart cards can be purchased from all Metro stations in Lucknow at a cost of Rs 200, including Rs 100 as security money refundable at the time of returning the card while Rs 100 can be used to pay fare.

column2: Ghaziabad: Out of jail, youth shot on busy road
column3: GHAZIABAD: A 25-year-old man was shot dead by two unidentified bike-borne assailants on the busy Railway station road in Kavi Nagar on Saturday afternoon. The deceased, Vinod Kumar alias Bhajji, was a resident of Sector 23 in Sanjay Nagar. “The deceased was a criminal. More than 15 cases of robbery, theft and some under the NDPS Act were registered against him in Delhi-NCR. Two months back, he got out of jail,” a senior police officer said. Vinod’s father Rajaram said his son used to live separately but came home every 10 days. Around 11.30 am, he went outside the house on his bike. “He told his mother that he was going to meet one of his friends and will be back for dinner. Fifteen minutes later, I got information about his death,” said the father. Latest Commentp 5: That’s It you got free 1GB 3G/4G data for free.Terms & Conditions Of Airtel Free Data Offer:    You will get 1GB data free    To get free data you need to download the A...Read MoreVikrantSee All CommentsAdd commentAnil Kumar Shahi, the SHO of Kavi Nagar police station, told TOI that two persons on a white Apache accosted Vinod and asked him to stop the bike. As soon as he did, the two men fired at him. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“Preliminary investigation suggests gang rivalry as the reason behind the murder on a busy road during the day,” he added.

column2: Madhuban Bapudham: Ghaziabad Development Authority begins land takeover
column3: GHAZIABAD: The Ghaziabad Development Authority (GDA) has started taking physical possession of land for its Madhuban Bapudham housing scheme. GDA intends to take over 100 acres of land in the next 10 days, officials said. Latest Commentp 5: That’s It you got free 1GB 3G/4G data for free.Terms & Conditions Of Airtel Free Data Offer:    You will get 1GB data free    To get free data you need to download the A...Read MoreVikrantSee All CommentsAdd comment“The enhanced land compensation has been paid to farmers through the district administration for which we had to take a loan of Rs 800 crore. Within 10 days, we will take physical possession of 100 acres of land of a total of 281 acres,” said Santosh Rai, secretary, GDA. GDA’s Madhuban Bapudham is spread in an area of 1,231 hectares which has 2,570 number of plots under different categories. There are over 254 MLA plots, 762 developed plots earmarked for farmers whose land were acquired and 1,554 plots for normal buyers on whom the increased land rates will be charged. GDA was forced to revisit land rates of plots after a group of farmers moved the Allahabad high court demanding higher land compensation. The case went to Supreme Court that ordered the GDA in 2007 to pay enhanced compensation to farmers under the Land Acquisition (Rehabilitation & Resettlement) Act, 2013.

column2: IAS Anurag Tiwari's death was accident, reiterates CBI
column3: LUCKNOW: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has reiterated in court that the death of Karnataka-cadre IAS Anurag Tiwari was accidental and not murder. In its reply filed in CBI court on Friday, in response to the protest petition filed by Tiwari's younger brother Mayank in the first week of September, the premier investigative agency again submitted that the death was accidental. Latest CommentAfter so many incidents, regular news of unsolved murder, planned revenge and COVERUP-- UP Police has no credibility.SUBRATASee All CommentsAdd commentThe special CBI court has fixed December 3 as the next date of hearing. Karnataka cadre IAS officer, Anurag Tiwari (36) was found dead under mysterious circumstances outside the state guesthouse in Lucknow on May 17, 2017. CBI took over probe on June 17, 2017, and filed a murder case and filed a closure report on February 20, 2019 after investigating for 20 months. Mayank had challenged the closure report on September 17 pointing out several flaws in CBI probe and had raised several questions on its findings. Mayank's allegations are baseless and not backed by facts, CBI said in its reply. Probe was carried out scientifically while assistance of a panel of doctors from AIIMS, Delhi, and CFSL was sought. All the recovered documents were scrutinised and showed no threat perception from any senior officers or politicians. Hence, it was concluded that Tiwari met an accident. Mayank's counsel Nutan Thakur said the unanswered questions include sudden change of WhatsApp number, cancellation of flight for Bengaluru on May 16, hours after booking and then booking another flight via Kolkata besides many others.

column2: ‘Ayushmann says for me ki ‘yeh ladki single kyun hai?'’ Nushrat Bharucha in Lucknow
column3: After reigning over the big screen with her performance in the hit film 'Dream Girl', which also starred Ayushmann Kkhurrana, actress Nushrat Bharucha is all set to rule the Box Office with her upcoming films 'Turram Khan' and 'Hurdang', among other projects. The actress has been working back-to-back and on a recent work trip to Lucknow, Nushrat spoke at length about her journey in the industry and how things have changed for her since her Kartik Aaryan starrer 'Sonu ke Titu Ki Sweety' (SKTKS). Q. You were recently shooting for Hurdang in Allahabad and now you’re in Lucknow. What brings you to here?Honestly, I can’t speak about my project just yet but you’ll know with time for sure. It’s something unique, and hopefully you’ll like it. Speaking of Lucknow, I had the most scrumptious food here. The day we landed, we went to Dastarkhwan and had all the amazing dishes that were offered to us right from galawati kebabs, laccha parantha, mutton korma to shami kebabs with some special parantha that is meant to be had with those kebabs only. We even had the famous Tundey kebabs and biryani with the boondi raita and pineapple raita. After that, we went to Nirulas and had the hot chocolate fudge with extra chocolate sauce and extra nuts. Itna sab khaaya aur phir bharke gym kiya. Q. Life seems to have taken off since SKTKS for you.NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Yes, I’m very happy with what’s come my way because I always felt that the biggest reward is when you get the option of choices and specially good choices. I think the fact that good choices of films meri taraf aayi, where I could pick them, was quite rewarding. Sometimes what happens is that you really want to do a certain film but it isn’t offered to you, you can’t do much in a situation like that. I believe I should pick different kinds of roles, even if the film concept is not so new. The character should be different. Every actor wants to do roles jahan unko mazaa aaye, of course. All my films are consciously different from each other, joh abhi aayengi, 'Dream Girl' was different, 'Turram Khan' is absolutely different, 'Hurdang' is altogether a different ballgame. I was astoundingly offered three completely different films back-to-back. It was also about discovering whether I could do those types of films or not. There were questions in my mind like how will I perform? How will I adapt? Darr bhi lagta hai but mujhe usmein mazaa bahot aata hai. So I had to do those films, there was no two ways about it but to say yes to those projects. Nushrat Bharucha with Ayushmann Khurrana in Dream Girl (BCCL)  Nushrat Bharucha with Ayushmann Khurrana in Dream Girl (BCCL) Q. Were you not apprehensive saying yes to a movie in which Ayushmann was starring, considering that he tends to own a film completely?For me, who owns a film from an actor’s point of view has never been the reason to take a script on or to even let that thought enter my brain. Mere liye film sabse badi hoti hai. If I’m enjoying a film when it’s being narrated to me, I want to be a part of it. I’m like mazaa aayega and this has to be credited to me in some way even if the story is about a boy who is taking the entire story ahead. For me, I found 'Dream Girl' so funny, I was laughing the first one hour of the narration. He (director Raaj Shaandilyaa) didn’t even have to wait one day, I said I want to do this film, and I personally felt that the film will do well. When you have such a strong vibe and connect with a film, phir aur kuchh dimaag mein aata nahi hai. My criteria for selecting a film is ki kuchh alag karne ko mila and I’ll enjoy doing the film, I know. The story and script play a crucial role while saying yes to a film for me. Q. You have been in Bollywood for quite some time now. Now, do you think you’re finally getting your due in the industry?I live by this thought, ‘waqt se pehle, waqt se zyaada kisi ko nahi milta’. So agar yeh waqt tha and itna milna tha toh mila. I cannot sit today and say ‘Oh! Now I’ve got my due’. Maybe not, maybe two years later I’ll get more. I mean there is no reason to put yourself in those thoughts. There are so many other productive thoughts that you can concentrate on to build yourself better. I’m thankful that I get to play different kinds of roles and I enjoy the work that I do. I don’t want to be on a set where I’m not enjoying. That’s the only thing I would dread. Q. You’re a product of non-nepotism and you’re hanging out and are friends with people who have been blamed for nepotism. How does it feel?I’m not from nepotism but I’m still friends with people who apparently were blamed for that. I am close to Manish (Malhotra), I’m really close to him. So doesn’t it take away from the fact that maybe they were blamed wrongly? I feel like these are just tags and labels people give which is okay. Every individual is entitled to their own set of opinions and I have mine. I’ve already spoken a lot on nepotism. Manish (Malhotra, fashion designer) out of nowhere picked up the phone, when he's never met me, he’s only seen my film and said ‘Come and do my show’. It is a genuine bond that I share with him. We don’t know each other from anywhere. I’m not a model, in fact, I don’t even have the height for one and yet he calls me for a fashion show. He was just like mazaa aayega and ever since I walked for his show, we’ve just been friends. Sophie Choudhary happens to be another really chill friend who I love hanging out with along with Rajkummar Rao, Patralekha, Diana Penty, Pooja, Suraj and Siddharth Malhotra. There’s like a bunch and mix of people who are there and then we’re just partying. There are no barriers, we have a great time. I love that space, that’s the kind of vibe I like. Nushrat Bharucha in Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety (BCCL)  Nushrat Bharucha in Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety (BCCL) Q. Two of your films have touched the 100 crore mark. So are you expecting the same from your upcoming films as well?This 100 crores has become like a tag that people give for a successful film. But what does it translate into? If I have to look at it from the grass-root level, so many people have seen your film, meaning so many people have liked you, which means so many people have wanted to watch you more. Aapka fan base badhta hai, you connect with so many people. I only think of it in a way that I was able to reach so many more people than my previous film. That’s how it translates for me as an actor as of now. The audience is your main judge, they have the power to make you and break you. The fact that it is reaching so many people is great. Q. How has Nushrat changed post SKTKS’ success?I won’t say I have changed changed. But yes, I have just learnt how to judge people better, if I may say so. I’m the same person but what I’ve learnt is to understand who you’re talking to and what your relationship with the person is and deal with them accordingly. That was my learning process. Q. Kangana has been all flags for pay parity. What about you? Does that thought prop in your mind?I have just come to this industry. We were a bunch of complete newcomers. I haven’t worked with a big star wherein I would understand the difference in pay as such. I feel like I’m still nascent in this journey. I feel like it’ll take me a while to come to a place where an issue like this becomes my issue also. Having said that, I’m all for people who are standing up for it and making a path for us to maybe take. Priyanka Chopra is very inspiring, I feel. I remember Priyanka said this to me and it really stuck. She said ‘If I have done this, it should be more of a motivation for you all to kind of take that path because I paved the way, you’ve just got to walk the correct path now.’ So I feel someone has paved a path for me and one day hopefully I pave a path for someone else. Who inspires who and when is the point. Someone’s going to have an impact on you and one day you’ll probably be creating a similar impact on someone else. Q. Anything happening on the personal front?I’m still single. Honestly I haven’t even had the time since 'Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety'. I feel that void of not having that special someone when I’m watching a movie, perhaps. Those basic times I feel I wish I had someone but my friends easily fill in that gap. You always have people. I don’t mind dating someone from within or outside the industry, it's irrelevant. I just need to like the guy. Even Ayush (Ayusshmann) says that a lot, he says, ‘Yeh ladki single kyun hai? Thought process correct hai, balanced hai’, it's funny'! Eventually even Ayush agrees that we should ask the guys what the problem is. Nushrat Bharucha in Lucknow (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  Nushrat Bharucha in Lucknow (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) Q. Any plans of getting married?I definitely want to get married but not anytime soon. Also, I want to adopt kids. If my partner and I mutually agree for the same it’ll be great, if not, I don’t mind being a single mother, either. I’d absolutely love to adopt kids and, I will. — With inputs from Yashi Agarwal

column2: Abhimanyu Dassani and Shirley Setia go for a bike ride for film shoot in Lucknow
column3: Actress Bhagyashree’s son Abhimanyu Dassani and singer and social media sensation Shirley Setia have begun shooting for Sabbir Khan’s 'Nikamma' in Lucknow. The duo was spotted shooting a scene early morning on Sunday with Abhimanyu riding a bike and Shirley riding pillion. The two actors went riding on a yellow bike with a Delhi number plate from the Safed Baradari till Rumi Darwaza in Chowk to can the shots. Abhimanyu, who made his debut with 'Mard Ko Dard Nahi Hota' earlier this year is, excited to be in Lucknow as is Shirley, who both posted pics from the city on Instagram to announce their arrival here. The youngsters will also be joined by actress Shilpa Shetty who makes a comeback on the big screen after nearly 12 years with this film. The 'Baazigar' and 'Main Khiladi Tu Anari' actress is expected to reach Lucknow in a couple of days and will be shooting for the romantic comedy during a marathon schedule of 45 days which will also be shot in Hardoi and Malihabad. column2: Maharashtra people want stable government: Ramdas Athawale
column3: KANPUR: Union minister and chief of the Republican Party of India (RPI) Ramdas Athawale on Sunday said the BJP along with NCP would try its best to prove the majority during the floor test in Maharashtra assembly on November 30. “As governor of Maharashtra invited BJP-NCP to prove majority, they will try their best on November 30,” Athawale said while talking to mediapersons during his visit to the city. He said Shiv Sena, NCP and Congress should have taken the decision of forming a coalition government quickly and not after several days of declaration of the Maharashtra results. “The people of Maharashtra want a stable government which is capable of resolving their issues”, he said. Athwale also said that he was very hopeful that many MLAs would come together and that there is no pressure on any MLA. The MLAs should come forward and support their government and if they do so, they are most welcome, he added. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.

column2: Kanpur: 25-year-old ends life after being scolded by father
column3: KANPUR: A 25-year-old youth committed suicide in Nawabganj area of the city on late Saturday night allegedly after being scolded by his father. The youth, Suryasheesh, son of Nilendra Singh, a resident of DeenDayal Nagar Colony in Nawabganj, was pursuing LLB from a local college. His family members told the cops that the youth’s father had scolded him for not parking the two-wheeler inside the house. “As his bike was parked outside the house for the past two days, his father asked him to bring it inside. When he did not pay heed to his instructions, his father on late Saturday night scolded him for disobeying him. On late Saturday night, his sister knocked the door of his room and when she didn’t get any response she peeped inside the room through a window and found his brother’s body hanging from the ceiling,” said inspector Nawabganj Dilip Kumar Bind. She informed her parents who immediately cut loose the rope that their son had used to hang himself and called a family doctor who declared him dead. The body was later shifted to the mortuary. On inspecting the room, the police did not find any suicide note in the room except the mobile phone. The police said that they were questioning the deceased family members to find out if there could be some other reason for taking the extreme step. The youth’s mobile phone and other electronic devices were also being checked. column2: Kanpur: Man in relation with two women killed for betrayal
column3: KANPUR: A man, who was allegedly having an affair with two women for the past several years, was killed by the father and uncle of two women. SP (East), Raj Kumar Agarwal, said, that deceased Sartaj, a tannery worker, lived with his mother and other family members in Jajmau area under Chakeri police station, and was in a relationship with two women. When the women came to know about him having affair with both of them, they accused him of betraying them and asked him to end the affair. When he refused to do so, father and uncle of the two women, after luring him on November 2, murdered him and later threw his body into Ganga. The incident came to light when Sufia, Sartaj’s mother, lodged a missing complaint at the Chakeri police station on November 3. Police later converted the missing complaint into kidnapping and later arrested the father and the uncle of the two women who spilled the beans. Following sustained grilling, they broke down and confessed to having committed the murder.” Both the accused--one woman’s father and the other woman’s uncle--have been arrested in this regard. Search operations are underway in Ganga as Sartaj’s body is yet to be recovered. Police were gathering evidence against the two accused, said a police officer. column2: Kanpur: DM reviews arrangements for President visit
column3: KANPUR: District magistrate Vijay Vishwas Pant on Saturday asked officials to complete preparations for President Ram Nath Kovind’s visit to Kanpur by November 26. The President is scheduled to attend three programmes at Kanpur University, Kanpur Municipal Corporation and PSIT Institute on November 30. Holding a meeting to review preparations, Pant said public works department (PWD), Kesco, municipal corporation, Jal Nigam, fire brigade and organisers had been issued necessary directions. He said the President would attend three programmes in the city and officials had been assigned duties. “Officials and employees should get their duty pass from the city magistrate’s office. Without pass, no one will be allowed to enter the premises,” he said. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.IG Police (zone) Mohit Agarwal said adequate police force had been deployed. “Aero state camera will be used for rooftop and aerospace vigil. At three venues, 9 ASP rank IPS, 16 ASP, 60 DySP, 2,400 non-gazetted officers, 10 PAC battalions, two squads of paramilitary force, anti-bomb squad and drones will be pressed into service. As per the schedule of the President’s visit, his aircraft would land at Chakeri airport from where he will move to PSIT in a chopper. Thereafter, he will reach Kanpur University and later visit municipal corporation’s officer where he will be felicitated. In another development, the district administration has provided relief to the Sikh community by allowing people to attend ‘langar’ on the martyrdom day of Guru Teg Bahadur on November 30, barring between 1.30pm and 5pm. Earlier, the district administration had cancelled permissions granted for functions on November 29 and 30. The relaxation was made after the members of Guru Singh Sabha met district magistrate, ADM (city) Vivek Srivastava and municipal commissioner Akshay Tripathi. Officials decided that though ‘langar’ would be allowed, entry to Motijheel would remain prohibited from 1.30-5.00 pm. Kanpur police have made elaborate security arrangements for visit of President Ram Nath Kovind to the city on November 30.

column2: Probe ordered into Chaubeypur suicide
column3: KANPUR: A probe has been ordered in connection with a suicide incident in which a 28-year-old woman had hanged herself at her house in Rameshpur village under Chaubeypur police station on Saturday following alleged police harassment. The woman’s family members accused beat sub-inspector Rakesh Kumar of demanding bribe from Karan Singh, the husband of deceased woman Usha and threatening to implicate him in a two-year-old case in which he had allegedly become a fake witness during the registry of a property in 2017. The family members alleged that two years ago, one Subedar Singh had filed a case of cheating and forgery against Usha’s husband Karan Singh accusing him of becoming a fake witness during the registry of land belonging to him. They have accused SI Rakesh Kumar of harassing and demanding money from Karan Singh for the same. After giving Rs 1 lakh, the case was somehow dismissed, but on Saturday again SI Rakesh Kumar demanded Rs 1 lakh more. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“Usha received a message on her mobile phone from some number on Saturday following which she went inside her room and committed suicide”, her family members further alleged. The police investigation regarding Usha’s suicide is underway. However, in yet another twist, Usha’s brother lodged an FIR against her husband Karan and his siblings on Sunday accusing them of harassing his sister to bring cash worth Rs 50,000 from her parents to buy land. It was when she refused, they killed her and later hanged her body from the ceiling to give it a colour of suicide, he stated in the FIR. “A probe has been ordered in this regard. Police are investigating the case from both angles. We are also awaiting the postmortem report as it will ascertain the actual cause of Usha’s death”, said circle oficer Bilhaur Devendra Mishra.

column2: 10 UP Congressmen expelled for defying Priyanka Gandhi
column3: LUCKNOW: Congress on Sunday sacked 10 of the 11rebels in UP pradesh committee who had defied general secretary Priyanka Gandhi’s attempts to revamp the party in the state by opposing the appointment of Ajay Kumar Lallu as the UP unit chief. The 10 members, including Santosh Singh who was one of the representatives in AICC from UP, were expelled from Congress for six years. The sacked UP PCC members had opposed Priyanka saying their “decades of hard work and seniority were overlooked” by the party leadership while appointing Lallu, whom they considered “too junior and inexperienced”. The rebels held open sessions and handed out press statements against Lallu’s appointment, which were seen as an act of defiance.

column2: Lucknow: Two cops take Rs 200 bribe from driver
column3: LUCKNOW: The station house officer of Thakurganj was sent to police lines on Sunday after his two juniors - a head constable and a sub-inspector - were caught on camera accepting bribe from a tractor trolley driver. The accused head constable Munendra Nath Yadav and sub-inspector Vijay Singh have been suspended. The action against the trio was taken after a video of the incident went viral on social media. In the 30 seconds video, head constable Munendra Nath Yadav was heard demanding Rs 200 from a tractor trolley driver. The driver gave him a Rs 100 note but Yadav demanded more money. Then the driver was seen handing over a Rs 200 note to Yadav after which he was allowed to go. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Sub-inspector Vijay Singh was also present at the spot. They have been suspended for resorting to corrupt practices in the name of checking. Latest CommentAn ordinay policeman was caught for taking a bribe for Rs 200.00 and has been suspended.But what about those who are taking the bribe in crores and nothing happened. Some of the great persons even fl...Read MoreChaitanya AgarwalSee All CommentsAdd commentAfter the video went viral, senior police officials ordered a probe. SHO Thakurganj Neeraj Ojha was punished as his supervision was found faulty. Ojha had already been transferred but he was still holding the post of SHO Thakurganj. Meanwhile, senior police officials failed to explain why SHO Thakurganj was still holding the charge despite being transferred.

column2: AQI dips, but Lucknow breathing 'poor' air
column3: LUCKNOW: There was slight improvement in city's air on Sunday as pollution level dropped by 54 units as compared to Saturday. Lucknow's air quality index (AQI) was 260, which pushed air quality upward from 'very poor' to 'poor' category. Latest CommentEjezfjsgksglxmvvxmvzvmzcnzcmzvmzvmzv.Fjwjrsglylryltylrtorylsylsglsyldxzyodlgeyrylrtkwriqupetfkftksoteotdoyeirylsgksxx.vxgksylzdarjFNsfjtjajfstkdtkdyostksykdRitesh kumarSee All CommentsAdd comment"Over the past week, wind speed was as low as 2km/hr which has now improved to 6km/hr. There has been a drop in humidity level from 80% to 66% which has improved air quality," said director, Lucknow University's weather and pollution monitoring cell, Prof Dhruvsen Singh. He said moderate increase in wind velocity helped in dispersing pollutants to some extent thereby bringing down AQI. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Pollution levels in eight cities of Uttar Pradesh also witnessed improvement by 60-110 units due to higher wind velocity and lower humidity. Air quality of three UP cities shifted from 'poor' to 'moderate' category with maximum drop of 110 units in Baghpat. It was followed by Hapur and Meerut with AQI of 146 and 194, respectively. Air quality of other UP cities including Ghaziabad (240), Greater Noida (226), Varanasi and Noida (225) also improved from 'very poor' to 'poor'.
