column2: Lucknow University turns 100 today, throws open gates for campus tour
column3: LUCKNOW: The gates of Lucknow University will be opened to the public to mark the beginning of centenary year celebrations on Monday. The entry to the university, established in 1921, will begin with a morning walk by the students and teachers from the Chhatrapati Shivaji sports ground on the campus. Lucknow University will be opened to the public on MondayA plantation drive will also be carried on the day. Under it, 100 saplings to mark the centenary year will be planted on the campus. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“Any student or a commoner can visit the university’s K.S Mathur Antroplogical Museum, known for its ancient artefacts of tribal culture collected from across the country. Similarly, zoology and geology museums would also remain open,” said LU spokesperson Durgesh Srivastava. Visitors can also take a tour of the varisty’s vast treasure trove — Tagore Library. Latest CommentcongratulationsRewardingSee All CommentsAdd commentThe centenary address will be delivered by the officiating vice-chancellor SK Shukla. The inaugural day will conclude with a kavi sammelan. The foundation day of the university is celebrated on November 25 as the University Bill got the then governor general’s nod on November 25, 1920.

column2: Irked over land row, dalit sets self ablaze at Bapu Bhawan
column3: LUCKNOW: Irked over a property dispute, a dalit youth set himself afire at Bapu Bhawan on Sunday. The youth, Amit Rawat of Fatehganj in Para area, sustained 70% burns and his condition is said to be serious. Rawat had a dispute with Jitendra Chaurasiya of Saadatganj who had purchased land from him in 2013. Jitendra got the land registered in his name but did not make full payment. Latest CommentInu view the caste of the youth should have not been highlighted by way of responsible journalism, as this seems not to be a caste related matter problem.Gora ChandSee All CommentsAdd commentPolice spokesman Ashish Dwivedi said Rawat contacted police control room on Sunday morning when Jitendra tried to take possession of the land. "Police intervened and stopped the possession. Rawat went to gate number 2 of Bapu Bhawan with his friend Dharmendra and set himself afire. Dharmendra was arrested on charges of abetment to suicide and is being probed by ASP (east)," he said.

column2: Lucknow: Gang used fake papers for vehicle loans, busted
column3: LUCKNOW: A gang which duped several banks and finance companies of over Rs 50 lakh was busted on Sunday with the arrest of seven gang members. The arrested persons were identified as Amit Yadav of Aligarh and Rehan Khan of Sadatganj (gang leaders), Anand Kumar of Krishnanagar, Amit Kumar of Allahabad, Mohammed Shamim of LDA Colony, Alimuddin aka Osama of Aligarh and Vivek Dwivedi of Madiaon. A manager of an automobile showroom in Hazratganj had lodged a case against unidentified miscreants who had got an SUV financed by submitting fake documents. Explaining the modus operandi, inspector crime branch, Anjani Pandey said Anand and Anil got Aadhaar cards made in their names on fake addresses. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy."The gang used fake documents to secure loans from banks and finance companies and later bought bikes and cars from the showrooms," he said. The gang members then sold these vehicles to different customers at low prices and did not repay loans to the banks and finance companies. The police traced the gang after it received complaints about similar unpaid loans from many banks in the state capital.

column2: Home guards wage scam: Rot runs deep in Lucknow
column3: LUCKNOW: The home guards wages scam in Lucknow is getting bigger as the ongoing probe being conducted by Gomtinagar police has revealed that the missing company commander Sushil Singh and platoon commander were also hand in glove with arrested district commandant Kripa Shanker Pandey and were sharing the spoils. The scrutiny of documents seized from the district office of home guard at Maqdoompur have revealed several anomalies and police officials, who had detected misappropriation of Rs five lakhs each at Gudamba and Vibhutikhand police stations in July and August, are now probing home guards' deployment at the two stations since 2017. Officials said muster rolls of nine more police stations are also under scrutiny. Senior police officers said muster rolls of Chinhat, BKT, Itaunja, Kakori, Malihabad, Nagram, Maal, Nigohan and Gosainganj police stations are under scanner. "All these police stations were under company commander Sushil Singh who is absconding. A team has been set up under SP (north) Amit Kumar to nab him along with platoon commander," said an officer privy to the probe. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Sources said the documents recovered in raids also reveal the involvement of three subordinates of district commandant Kripa Shankar. They also did not rule out possibility of documents being tampered by the staff. A five-member team has also been constituted to record statements of the workers of home guard district office in Gomtinagar. The documents were seized in raids after the arrest of district commandant of home guards, Lucknow, Kripa Shankar Pandey, by Gomtinagar police on Thursday. Pandey is accused of fraudulently withdrawing wages of home guards by showing inflated figures of their deployment at two police stations in the state capital in July and August, causing a loss of Rs 10 lakh to the state exchequer.

column2: In UP, 10 Congressmen who defied Priyanka Gandhi expelled
column3: LUCKNOW: Cracking down on a simmering rebellion by the old guard, the grand old party on Sunday purged the Uttar Pradesh unit of 10 veterans, who openly defied party national general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's attempt to revamp the moribund state machinery into a lean, mean force. The disciplinary action showed Priyanka is clearly in a hurry to quell dissent and make the party fighting fit before 2022 Assembly elections. The 10 party veterans, including AICC member Santosh Singh were expelled for six years after being slapped with showcause notices. The order was passed by UP Congress disciplinary committee comprising Shyam Kishor Shukla, Imran Masood and Ajay Rai. Referring to media reports that documented meetings by rebel elders to condemn the party's decision to put in place a dynamic state leadership, the order stated they were issued showcause notices with a 24-hour deadline to reply. The panel stated it was not satisfied with replies and they had defied the party's code of conduct. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.The senior leaders said their decades of hard work and seniority were overlooked while appointing Ajay Kumar Lallu as UPCC president, whom they consider too junior and inexperienced. The rebels had held open sessions and handed out press statements, which were seen as an act of defiance. Former Kanpur MLA showcaused, sparedSenior leaders who were expelled include former member of Parliament and AICC member Santosh Singh, former MLA and UPCC member Siraj Mehndi, former home minister R K Dwivedi, former minister Satyadev Tripathi, AICC member Rajendra Singh Solanki, former MLA Bhoodhar Narayan Mishra, former MLA Vinod Chaudhary, Nek Chandra Pandey, former UP Youth Congress chief Swayam Prakash Goswami and former head of Gorakhpur district unit Sanjiv Singh. The exception, however, was former MLA from Kanpur Hafiz Mohd Omar, who was slapped with a showcause, but not expelled. Omar reportedly told the high command that he landed at the rebels’ meet due to a confusion. He said he had gone to attend a function on Pandit Nehru’s birth anniversary and was not aware about protests. Latest CommentThis is democracy, freedom of expression, liberty ,  no one is above the family. all Boot kickers.PandeySee All CommentsAdd commentThe move triggered dual reactions from the party office. “Those inclined to seniors felt it will add fuel to the fire while the GenNext in the party believe it will set a precedent,” said a Congressman. Senior leaders expressed disbelief. “Many of us did not get a copy of the showcause notice, which had been doing rounds in media. Neither have we been intimated about the expulsion,” said Siraj Mehndi, former MLC. He also said he would be convening a meeting of party veterans at his residence on Monday before calling a press conference.

column2: In UP, 10 Congressmen who defied Priyanka Gandhi expelled
column3: LUCKNOW: Cracking down on a simmering rebellion by the old guard, the grand old party on Sunday purged the Uttar Pradesh unit of 10 veterans, who openly defied party national general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's attempt to revamp the moribund state machinery into a lean, mean force. The disciplinary action showed Priyanka is clearly in a hurry to quell dissent and make the party fighting fit before 2022 Assembly elections. The 10 party veterans, including AICC member Santosh Singh were expelled for six years after being slapped with showcause notices. The order was passed by UP Congress disciplinary committee comprising Shyam Kishor Shukla, Imran Masood and Ajay Rai. Referring to media reports that documented meetings by rebel elders to condemn the party's decision to put in place a dynamic state leadership, the order stated they were issued showcause notices with a 24-hour deadline to reply. The panel stated it was not satisfied with replies and they had defied the party's code of conduct. column2: Beating stereotypes, this 'dhol' player drums up support for gender equality
column3: LUCKNOW: Dressed in a white and blue attire, her stance upright and eyes focused, 21-year-old Jahan Geet Singh's rendition of 'dhol' filled the air during the ongoing Kabir Festival on Sunday. Bearing the weight of 8kg 'dhol' on her shoulders with ease, Jahan Geet, said to be the youngest 'dhol' player in the country, mesmerized one and all with strong drum beats. Breaking stereotypes, Jahan Geet entered the male-dominated profession of 'dholis' at the tender age of 12. Eight year on, Jahan Geet, a law student, is using beats to drum up support for various causes, including women empowerment. Latest CommentYahi sab kuchh chal raha hai kya is duniya mein bhaiya kya ho raha hai yah aur sab bahut chhutiyan chal rahi hai matlab kya bataen aur hello kya ho raha hai news mein Aaj ke liye hi sab chal raha hai kya okKomal BharatiSee All CommentsAdd comment"I was attracted to 'dhol' instantly when my cousin performed at an event. But it wasn't easy. A lot many tutors refused to train me and said the instrument is not meant for girls. However, after refusals, I was guided by Sardar Kartar Singh in 2013," she says. "At times, my tutor would ask me to 'play like a man' and my reply used to be that I will play like a girl and it will be better than men's performance," she says. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.With a number of awards in her kitty, Jahan Geet plans to make 'dhol' more universal by attempting fusion with future artists.

column2: Indian celebrities are still not used to the idea of roasting in comedy: Shobhit Sinha
column3: In Lucknow some time back for a surprise birthday party for his mom, comedy writer Shobhit Sinha was on cloud nine as he had bagged a Bollywood film as a solo dialogue writer. "I am right now doing a film with debut director Ishrat Khan as a dialogue writer, who has been an associate director with Anees Bazmee sir. The film’s name is Salman Tune Shadi Kyun Ki. It is a comedy film. The cast is yet to be finalised but the concept is quite interesting of the film. It is about the privacy of a newlywed couple in Mumbai as they are living in a joint family and the house is quite small. Interestingly, I have picked up a lot of funny punches from my experience of living in Lucknow. In a city like Lucknow you will get many such cases too. In fact, a lot of my humour comes from Lucknow. Even in my animation show Honey Bunny Ka Jholmaal, I try to incorporate my Lakhnawi humour," he said. Shobhit Sinha (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui) Shobhit Sinha (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui) There were once several comedy shows, especially stand-up ones doing very good on TV. In fact, every channel had a show. But of late we only have The Kapil Sharma Show on air. "Yeh sirf time-time ki baat hai. The pitching for several comedy shows on different channels is still on and soon you will see many more comedy shows back on air. Most of the comedy shows are there for only a few months only. Even Comedy Night Bachao was there for only a limited time," says Shobhit. The Lucknow lad adds, “But Comedy Nights Bachao, which was on the concept of roasting, didn’t go down well with a lot of celebrities who appeared on it, with a few even leaving the show mid-way. “Yes, the show was a little bit too much for the Indian celebrities, who are still not used to the whole idea of roasting. But we will soon be coming up with another season of the show, which will be a mellowed down version to suit the Indian sensibilities. Not everyone can be like Ranveer Singh, who is quite pro roasting. Also this time we have planned to keep roasting optional for celebrities who are willing for it.’ NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Shobhit Sinha (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui) Shobhit Sinha (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui) What does he has to say about the present scene of comedy on TV, especially The Kapil Sharma Show. "If you talk about comedy on The Kapil Sharma Show, I have, as a comedy writer, always believed that it has always the perfect combination of the team, that has been in favour of Kapil. As far as Krushna Abhishek’s entry or replacement for Sunil Grover in the show goes, both are quite different from each other. While Sunil has the art of getting into the skin of every character he plays, Krushna has the art of making people laugh as himself only. He is the king of stand-up comedy today. Both cannot be compared and are not each others’ substitute."

column2: An exhibition inspired from rural art forms of India held in Lucknow
column3: A painting exhibition consisting of about 50-60 paintings titled Travelling Thoughts, was recently held at Lalit Kala Akademi in Aliganj. The exhibition was organised by contemporary artist Supriya Agarwal under the guidance of renowned photographer and artist Ravi Kapoor. (L) Alok Dalmia (R) Deepa and Shilpi (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) (L) Alok Dalmia (R) Deepa and Shilpi (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) The art exhibition was predominantly based on geometric and curvilinear forms inspired by the rural art forms of India. The artist explored several mediums for her paintings including aquarelle, acrylic, oil, inks, charcoal, etc. “I’ve been doing art right from childhood, since school. I’ve always felt very passionately about it. I’m so happy and excited to have had the opportunity of exhibiting my work here. Some of the pieces are old artworks from the time when I began doing this form of art and other pieces are very recent. Lines are the main soul of my paintings,” said Supriya. column2: 100+ renowned Muslims oppose Ayodhya review
column3: MUMBAI: Over 100 renowned Muslims from across the country, including actor Naseeruddin Shah, actor-activist Shabana Azmi, poet-Urdu columnist Hasan Kamaal, journalist Javed Anand and activist Feroz Mithiborwala have opposed the decision of some Muslim litigants, including All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB), to file a review petition of the Ayodhya verdict in the SC. “We share the unhappiness of the Indian Muslim community, constitutional experts and secular organisations over the fact that the highest court has placed faith above law in arriving at its decision. But while agreeing that the court order is judicially flawed, we strongly believe that keeping the Ayodhya dispute alive will harm, and not help, Indian Muslims,” said the statement. Javed Anand, who is also secretary of Indian Muslims for Secular Democracy, said it is high time the Muslims moved away from the mandir-masjid dispute as it helps to mask the real agenda of the Sangh Parivar, which is to replace the secular-democratic republic with a Hindu Rashtra. Top CommentMuslims should generously return the Hindu temples that were demolished by Muslim invaders and mosques built in that. They should feel ashamed and give up Islam and return to Hinduism which was their...Read MoreKullamani KunjappaSee All CommentsAdd commentThe signatories to the statement observed that continuation of the dispute will add fuel to anti-Muslim propaganda and Islamophobia and aid communal polarisation. “In choosing not to pursue the matter further, Muslims stand to gain the goodwill and empathy of the non-communal millions from the majority community. This will be in the best interests of the community and the country,” they said. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.At a meeting in Lucknow last week, the Muslim Personal Law Board and one faction of Jamiat Ulema-e-Hind decided that some Muslim litigants would go for review of the Supreme Court verdict, which gave the entire disputed land in Ayodhya to the Hindus while ordering the Centre to allot five acres in Ayodhya to the Muslims to build their mosque.

column2: Kanpur Metro work picks pace, euphoric residents mill around work sites
column3: KANPUR: The work of Kanpur Metro is gaining pace as on Sunday the Metro workers were found busy barricading the Metro route on GT Road near Kanpur University to streamline the traffic movement. The foundation stone of the Metro rail project was laid by chief minister Yogi Adityanath recently. Huge drilling machines were pressed into service to carry out the work of soil piling to pave way for Metro pillar construction. Excited locals and passersby gathered near the Metro work site to witness the ongoing work but they were asked to leave by the security personnel. Security men were also seen in managing the traffic movement. Halogen lights have been installed for carrying out work during the night time while radium stickers have been pasted on the green barricades to let vehicle drivers have a clear view of the road and the Metro work in progress. The Security personnel managing traffic donned nylon radium jackets. Cranes were used to erect green colour barricades. Latest CommentIntentionally delayed by 3yr. for Political gain as this would be completed around UP ElectionMohd. MoazzamSee All CommentsAdd commentA Metro staffer told TOI that with the work proceeding towards Motijheel end of the city, barricades would be placed to mark the area where Metro work would be done to save the people from hassles. The wide GT Road between Kanpur University and IIT-Kanpur has narrowed. Residents of the Kalyanpur area, where Metro station is to come up, were excited to see the work in progress. They said the Metro service would definitely change the face of the city and bring in a lot of facilities. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“Uttar Pradesh Metro Rail Corporation’s (UPMRCs) plan to construct parking spaces, coffee shops, food joints, etc at Metro stations will definitely add to the value of the Kanpur Metro”, said a local.

column2: Etawah Safari opens for public, lion segment to wait
column3: KANPUR: The wait for Etawah Safari finally got over on Sunday after the park was thrown open for public by UP forest minister Dara Singh Chauhan and Etawah MP and chairman of National Commission for Scheduled Castes Dr Ram Shankar Katheria. However, people will have to wait for some more time for the Lion Safari which will be opened after it fulfills norms laid down by Central Zoo Authority (CZA). Inaugurating the park, both Chauhan and Katheria praised SP patron Mulayam Singh Yadav and party president Akhilesh Yadav for their efforts to make the project a reality. Spread over a sprawling 350 hectare area, Etawah Lion Safari has been developed as a major tourist destination. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“As of now, deer, antelope and bear safaris have been opened for public. Lion Safari, which is the USP of the park, will open only after it meets CZA norms,” an official at the Safari said. As per norms, Lion Safari can be opened for public only if there are 10 cubs. Etawah Safari officials are trying hard to increasing the count of cubs. Currently, Etawah Safari has only six cubs. It is also the first in the country to have a lion breeding centre to develop a research facility on Asiatic lions. Antelope Safari boasts of 65 deers and six swamp deers. Bear safari has three female bears. Etawah Safari Park was formally inaugurated on June 1, 2018, by chief minister Yogi Adityanath. Etawah Safari is just two-hour drive from Agra, five hours from New Delhi and three hours from Lucknow. Work on Etawah Safari started in 2005 but gained momentum after environmental clearances in May 2013. According to Etawah Safari website, the park was first envisioned by former CM Mulayam Singh Yadav in 2005. Permission to establish a lion breeding centre and lion safari were obtained from the central government in 2013. The first pair of lions reached the Safari park in 2014. At present, there are 18 lions in the Safari of whom six are cubs.

column2: African worm, ivory from Indian riverbed wow visitors at Lucknow University
column3: LUCKNOW: From 85-year-old electric fish specimens brought from Brazil to the world’s longest elephant tusk, measuring 3.54 metre, found in the Yamuna riverbed at Kalpi — rare exhibits made jaws drop at Lucknow University on Monday. To mark the beginning of its centenary year, the varsity opened doors of its zoology, geology and anthropology museums to the common man. On display were objects and specimens collected painstakingly by eminent professors from across the country and abroad in the past 90-100 years. Although the turnout was low, the unique collection fascinated those who did visit the campus. “I had heard from my brother that LU’s zoology museum is among the best in the country. So, when the varsity opened its gates to students from outside, I decided not to miss the opportunity,” said Pragati Shashwat who studies at a private engineering college. If a 1.5-metre earthworm brought from Africa around 85 years ago fuelled intrigue, skeletons of various animals including a tiger and a tapir upped the curiosity quotient no less. Retired banker Anirudh Malhotra, on the other hand, was completely taken by rare fossils and gems at the geology museum. “I have never seen such a collection before. The world’s longest tusk, oldest fossil and the most unique rocks — you name it and LU has it,” he said. The anthropology museum flaunted artefacts of various tribes, including Tharu (from Nepal and eastern India) and those from Andaman and Nicobar islands, to engage visitors. Besides outsiders, LU alumni from the 1969, 1987 and 1991 batches too thronged all the museums on Monday.

column2: Century-old Lucknow University bats for career guidance & happiness quotient
column3: LUCKNOW: The centenary year celebrations of Lucknow University started on a propitious note for its students with the vice-chancellor announcing a full-fledged department for career counselling and guidance, happiness centre, and special arrangements for civil services aspirants in hostels on the occasion. Launching the year-long celebration on the 100th foundation day on Monday, officiating vice-chancellor S K Shukla announced that a career counselling and guidance department will be established with the objective of increasing the employability of students. An illiuminated building of Lucknow University; students take out a celebratory march and visitors marvel at scientific collection at a museum on the campusFormer LU student and Institute for Career Studies director Amrita Dass will be the adviser in the department and will guide students in making career choices according to their aptitude, interests, talent and aspirations, he said. The department will also provide latest updates on courses, scholarships and fellowships for improving career prospects, besides facilitating campus recruitments, said Dass. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Besides, a special section will be made in every hostel for students preparing for civil services. Language labs will also be started in all eight faculties to help students develop skills in Hindi and English. The computer centre which remains open during daytime will be available 24X7. The students will also get all their academic documents online. The university will also review the research work being carried out in various departments and will provide financial support to good ones. LU will also give funds to departments for organizing national and international seminars. A new ‘international hostel’ will also be constructed exclusively for foreign students. Earlier, students and teachers took out ‘centenary walk’ on campus in the morning and planted 100 neem and peepal saplings on the campus.

column2: Vishwa Hindu Parishad to record memoirs of Ram temple movement for posterity
column3: LUCKNOW: Vishwa Hindu Parishad has started cataloguing minute details of events during the Ram temple movement that eventually led to demolition of Babri Masjid in Ayodhya and people who took part in it. With the Supreme Court verdict paving the way for a temple of Ram Lalla at Ramjanmabhoomi, the right wing organisation has asked its cadres to fan out across the country and collect details and memoirs of kar sevaks, who took part in the movement that peaked with the Ram Rath Yatra taken out by BJP leader LK Advani. VHP sources said the organisation has preserved the list of people who were channelized in the movement. “All those people would be contacted for collecting details of their experience. The coming generations need to be told about the movement that changed the political landscape of the country,” VHP organisation secretary (east UP) Ambrish Singh told TOI. The families of kar sevaks who died while participating in the Ram temple movement would also be contacted for collecting details. The kar sevaks who got injured would be contacted and felicitated, Singh said. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“We’ve already felicitated some kar sevaks in and around Ayodhya,” he said. Anchal Singh Veera, a resident of Suakheda, near Bhopal, was grievously injured when the dome of Babri Masjid crumbled and has been confined to bed for past 27 years. The audio cassettes and video recordings of the fiery speeches of right wing leaders which were heavily circulated at the peak of the movement would also be collected. Though Singh said the motive was to collect exhaustive details of temple movement, sources said VHP plans to catalogue the minutiae in form of booklets that would be distributed among people.

column2: UP: ‘If I’d been patient, he would’ve been alive’
column3: LUCKNOW: “He was my only son. Had I been a little patient, my child would have been there with me,” said the remorseful father of class VI student who hanged himself at his house in Narhi on Sunday after being slapped and reprimanded for not scoring well in examination. Wondering how he could use harsh words for his son, the boy’s father on Monday appealed to all parents not to make such a mistake with their kids as it may cause irreparable damage to their lives. The 14-year-old was a student of a private school in Aliganj. The post-mortem report revealed hanging as the cause of death and no injury marks were found on the body, police said. The child’s father, who works with a private travel said: “I do not want anyone else to suffer the pain and mental agony that I am experiencing right now.” NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“At around 11am on Sunday, my wife returned home from parent-teacher meeting and told me that our son had failed in the examination again. While I was preparing to go to work, I got annoyed on hearing this and on the spur of the moment, I scolded my son as he would have to repeat the same class again,” he recalled. “I later realised that it is not necessary that every child should excel in studies. I would request all parents they should not scold children for scoring poorly. They should try to find out areas which interest them and tell them to work hard to pass the examination,” he said. Independent counsellor PK Khatri told TOI, “Parents should understand that all kids cannot become engineers or doctors and that there are many career avenues for children based on their talent and interest. Instead of scolding or beating, parents should sit with their children and try to understand their area of interest.”

column2: Lucknow trails Smart City mission, ranks 41
column3: LUCKNOW: The state capital may have moved up four notches since the last evaluation of projects executed under the Smart City mission, but the current rank of 41 among 100 cities in the country is no less of an embarrassment. Powered By                          10 Sec      Bangladesh deploys border guards after deadly anti-Modi protests	.stlp0{fill:#FF3E5F;}	.st1{fill:#fffffe;}	.st2{fill:#FF3E5F;}         .clsx-1{isolation:isolate;}.clsx-2{fill:#ff3e5f;}.clsx-3{fill:#fff;}NextStay     Bangladesh deploys border guards after deadly anti-Modi protestsNOW  PLAYINGBlocked Suez Forces Ships to Look at Long Trip Around AfricaNOW  PLAYINGSuez Canal Not Expected to Open Anytime SoonNOW  PLAYINGIndian farmers dance to mark four months of protestsNOW  PLAYINGIndia orders deportation of migrants who fled Myanmar military coupNOW  PLAYINGThe secret network helping Myanmar police fleeNOW  PLAYINGStuck Ship in Suez Canal Holds Up Oil and LNG ShipmentsNOW  PLAYINGWork to Re-Float Stuck Boat in Suez Canal SuspendedNOW  PLAYINGAt least four dead in Bangladesh Modi protestsNOW  PLAYINGMobius Sees Turkish Lira Remaining Steady as Dollar WeakensNOW  PLAYING  Arrow Left #1 Icon Created with Sketch.                 Arrow right #1 Icon Created with Sketch.               The awkwardness is a bit too pronounced when three other cities among the 10 in the fray from UP have done fairly well. Kanpur boasts an all-India rank of seven; Agra is in spot 12; and Varanasi is placed 13th, according to the data recently released by the ministry of housing and urban affairs. The rankings are based on the progress of projects meant for execution in 2019. A complete project has earned a city grade A; an ongoing project has secured grade B; and if a city has failed to launch a project, it has been graded C. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Lucknow had a target of seven projects, of which it couldn’t finish a single one. In five projects, the city got ‘B’ and two non-starter missions earned it ‘C’. The evaluation, which was earlier done annually, is now being done half-yearly. In 2018, the state capital had ranked 45. It held on to that position in the evaluation of projects done in the first half of 2019, the results of which were released in September. Under the Smart City mission, the city must complete 57 projects by 2024. Out of these, only three projects have been completed so far by the designated wing of Lucknow Municipal Corporation (LMC) while work is in progress for 36 others. The LMC is yet to launch the remaining 18 projects. According to civic officials, smart bus shelters, a command and control centre and solar panel installation at five government buildings are complete. Projects that are underway include the ambitious area-based development of Kaiserbagh. The development project involves automatic variable messaging boards to guide commuters; smart parking with an app informing people about available space in real time; and construction of roads with green belts and pavements, among other things. Latest CommentPata nahi yogi Lucknow se aisa sautela vyavahaar kyo kar rahe? Bura haal kar dia hai, sadak pe gandagi, samaaj ki gandagi sub badh gayi hai koi action nahi, he is proving to be a big dud.Ankit PantSee All CommentsAdd commentGeneral manager of LMC’s smart city project division SFA Zaidi blamed private contractors for the tardy pace of work. “We had to cancel the tenders of three projects because the hired agencies were laggard. Tendering is a long process and we need to ensure that all points are covered before a job is handed over,” he said.

column2: Bus-truck collision kills nine, injures 32 in Banda district
column3: JHANSI: Nine persons, including an eight-year old girl, were killed and 32 others injured as a UPSRTC bus collided with a truck in Banda on Monday. The accident took place near Semri village under Tindawari police station. The bus ferrying passengers from Banda to Fatehpur was hit by the speeding truck with force, ripping apart its body on the right side, and leaving behind a macabre sight. Police officials said the accident was so severe that nine persons, including four women, four men and an eight-year old girl, died on the spot with some bodies thrown out of the bus. Additional SP Banda, Lal Bharat Pal, said, “Out of 32 injured, five sustained grievous injuries and were referred to Kanpur medical college, while 12 others were admitted to district hospital. The rest are undergoing treatment at the community health centre.” NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.CM Yogi Adityanath expressed grief on the casualties and instructed Uttar Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation (UPSRTC) to ensure best treatment to the injured. Acting on CM’s directions, UPSRTC has announced Rs 5 lakh compensation to the families of the deceased from Yatri Rahat Kosh. Besides, Rs 2.5 lakh will be given to the grievously injured. On the directive of UPSRTC MD Raj Shekhar, an FIR was lodged against the truck driver and his assistant for gross criminal negligence. Shekhar, who inspected the accident spot, said the bus was moving at the speed of 50km/hour and was in the right lane. Hence, prime facie it was the truck driver’s fault, he added.

column2: Rebel Congress veterans say expulsion invalid, pin hopes on Sonia Gandhi for justice
column3: LUCKNOW: The 10 senior Congress leaders expelled from party on charges of indiscipline contested the action on Monday, saying their expulsion is against party constitution and they plan to meet party president Sonia Gandhi in next four-five days. The veterans, who were all AICC members, had been grumbling against their sidelining in recent state unit revamp with Ajay Kumar Lallu being appointed UPCC president. Former MLC Siraj Mehdi, at whose residence the seniors met on Monday, said, “The youngsters in party too would age at some point like us. Will they also be similarly discarded by Congress? We are not against the youth, but want to know what part is there for us in the plan.” Mehdi challenged the expulsion saying they did not even receive the notice the party claims to have sent. “We held a meeting on November 14 and November 21, and read in papers that a notice has been sent to us. None of us have received it till now, so there is no question of responding to it. The expulsion order says the party was ‘not satisfied’ with our response even though we never sent a response,” Mehdi said. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Another sacked veteran said, “In a hurry to expel us, the party gave us one day to respond when protocol is at least seven days.” Issuing a statement, the veteran said Priyanka Gandhi Vadra is a respected party member, but there is no provision in bylaws allowing a general secretary to sanction expulsion of AICC members. Satyadev Tripathi, a former minister, said, “Now, we will hold discussions with cadres on the state of Congress. We will start from Noida and then hold meetings in Poorvanchal and Bundelkhand.” “How can the party push out those who have given their entire lives for it? We are not against the Gandhi family or top leadership but our generation is being ignored,” he asked.

column2: UP: BJP invokes Dr BR Ambedkar, goes to 75 dists for Dalit outreach
column3: LUCKNOW: While the government is convening a special UP assembly session to mark the Constitution Day on Tuesday, BJP will use the occasion to make a Dalit outreach in all 75 UP districts. UP BJP will organise programmes to highlight the contribution of Dr BR Ambedkar, who played a pivotal role in the drafting of the Constitution, and the party’s efforts to improve the lot of Dalits. Sources in UP BJP said the party has planned workshops and mass contact programmes in Dalit-dominated pockets of all districts from Tuesday which will continue till November 30. The party brass has asked all its MPs, MLAs and senior party functionaries to participate in programmes which will essentially revolve around Ambedkar and his contribution in nation-building and how BJP leadership has been acknowledging his efforts. A year after the BJP stormed to power at the Centre in 2014, the government, through a gazette notification, declared November 26 as Constitution Day. It was on this day in 1949 that the Constituent Assembly of India adopted the Constitution of India which came into effect on January 26, 1950. In charge of state BJP’s SC/ST Morcha Govind Narayan Shukla said the objective of programmes would not only be to highlight Ambedkar’s contribution in nation-building but also BJP’s efforts towards Dalit emancipation through government welfare schemes. “Special focus will be on BJP’s efforts towards developing centres associated with Ambedkar as Panch Teerth,” Shukla told TOI. He said the five-day programme would be aimed at galvanizing Dalits who were being used as a vote bank by opposition parties. According to sources in the party, BJP aims to consolidate its position among Dalits after losing Zaidpur reserved seat to Samajwadi Party in the recently held by-elections. The party, however, managed to retain two other reserved seats – Balha and Iglas.

column2: Kanpur moves up in Smart City rankings
column3: LUCKNOW: Kanpur jumped up a spot to an all-India seventh rank, also retaining the top slot in UP for implementing Smart City projects in the latest list released by the Union ministry of housing and urban affairs. The list covers 10 UP cities under the Smart City mission. Top 3 smart cities in the country were Ahmedabad, Nagpur and Ranchi. Latest Commentsmart polluted cities?RewardingSee All CommentsAdd commentThe rankings were based on the progress of the implementation of Smart City projects to be completed in 2019. While earlier the evaluation was an annual exercise, it is being done for the second time in 2019 to expedite the implementation process. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.As compared to the first round of rankings released by the ministry in September this year, the second has Kanpur improving a rank from the earlier eighth, while Agra (12) and Varanasi (13) retained their rankings. Lucknow moved four places up to 41, while Allahabad took a dive from 51 to 56 rank in the list.

column2: Kids to get lessons on Constitution
column3: LUCKNOW: Primary school students would get lessons on the Indian Constitution from the new academic session. UP government has directed the basic education department to incorporate chapters on fundamental rights, duties and the preamble to the Constitution in textbooks as part of Constitution Day celebrations. The textbooks with the changes would be made available in the new session from class I to VIII, after a series of five-month events starting with the Constitution Day and concluding with the birth anniversary of Bhimrao Ambedkar on April 14. The move aims to instill a sense of patriotism, moral obligations towards the country and individual rights, said officials. “The Preamble, which highlights the objectives of the Constitution will be printed before the start of the chapters in line with the books of NCERT. The fundamental duties and fundamental rights will be incorporated from class I to VIII in parts so as to ensure that children can grasp the teaching imparted to them,” director, basic education, Sarvendra Vikram Bahadur Singh told TOI.

column2: UP: A fight to take down manual scavenging
column3: LUCKNOW: A gamut of social and non-governmental organisations decided to form a united front to put an end to the practise of manual scavenging in the state by December 2020, during the Kabir Festival in the city on Monday.  The move came following a call by Magasaysay awardee Bezwada Wilson during a discussion at the four-day event organised at Sangeet Kala Akademi. These outfits work in different spheres like human rights, women’s issues, environmental causes, rural development and rights of the LGBTQ community. The group would meet again on November 30 to chart out a roadmap to get rid of the inhumane practice which is still prevalent in several parts of the state. The front will be formally launched on Human Rights Day on December 10. According to the data collected by the non-profit ‘Safai Karmachari Andolan’ led by Wilson, UP is among states with the highest number of dry and service latrines. “There are around 5,58,090 dry latrines in the state, where manual scavenging is practised and more than 10,000 scavengers in the state who are forced to follow the inhumane practice. However, the state government is not even ready to find out if the practice is still prevalent,” Wilson said. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“The Centre always talks about schemes like the Swacch Bharat Abhiyan and smart cities, but what we really need is cities with smart sanitation and good sewerage systems. These manual scavengers need to be compensated. As per the data collated by SKA, there were 1,870 sewer deaths reported in India from 1993-2019,” he added while addressing the audience on the last day of the Kabir Festival on Monday. Latest CommentAwtkekteyorpuprtiqeuqepyrsgksmvzvmzmvzvmzfjafjsriwtiwiteoeitwjfsfkafisfjJfsvmzckzcmsgiwifwigeigwitsirqurqiteyoefisfjzmvzmvzmvzkvzigstoeotsigdgksRitesh kumarSee All CommentsAdd commentAn activist and the daughter of a manual scavenger, Pushpa Balmiki, said “Around 98% people involved in manual scavenging are Dalits and women from weaker sections. They should hired for more dignified jobs to rehabilitate them.” “Instead of depending on human beings to clean sewer tanks, governments should equip civic bodies with machines to do the same. We don’t want any more human beings to die in septic tanks or sewers,” said Raj Bhushan, a Mumbai-based activist who has been working against the practice.

column2: Indira’s trusted man who defeated a CM in a bypoll, now out of party
column3: LUCKNOW: Ram Krishna Dwivedi, once most-trusted man of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi has an unprecedented record to his credit – he defeated a chief minister in a byelection. Today, the 87-year-old Congress veteran is out in the cold, being one of the 11 members expelled by the party on charges of “indiscipline.” It was in 1971 that Dwivedi effected an upset win when Singh, contesting a byelection from Maniram Assembly constituency in Gorakhpur, vacated for him by Mahant Avaidhyanath, spiritual guru of present UP chief minister Yogi Adityanath. With the Sanyukt Vidhayak Dal (SVD) government — comprising Jan Sangh, Congress (O) and other regional factions – in power in UP, Singh was seeking election after replacing Charan Singh as chief minister who had stepped down following a crisis. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Dwivedi had decided to contest even at a time when Congress stalwarts like HN Bahuguna had declined the party was facing its first major crisis in the post-Nehru era after it was divided vertically and the newly-formed Congress (O) had posed a challenge to Indira. Amidst this crisis, Indira convinced Dwivedi to challenge the then chief minister TN Singh from Maniram. While Opposition stalwarts like Atal Bihari Vajpayee, Raj Narain and Karpoori Thakur campaigned for Singh, Indira took on them by campaigning for Singh, even in a byelection. Dwivedi was hailed as a ‘giant-killer’ when he was declared the winner on January 26. Diwedi, who went to jail as a student during the Quit India Movement, had also been home minister in UP and a CWC member during Indira’s prime ministership. He also headed UPCC’s disciplinary committee for 15 years and stood with the party in thick and thin times and never rebelled nor changed his political ideology despite the party being out of power in the state since 1989. When Congress national general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra began visiting Amethi and Rae Bareli to nurse the parliamentary constituencies of brother Rahul Gandhi and mother Sonia respectively about 15 years ago, it was Dwivedi who drummed up the slogan “Amethi ka danka, beti Priyanka.” Latest CommentOld stalwart of the congress who didnt got the dues or result inspite of of loyality and honesty with Congress. Would have used in beteer way by the congress or even leaders of the others political p...Read MoreManu Kumar MishraSee All CommentsAdd comment“Akhir meri khata kya hai” (what is my fault?), said a teary-eyed Dwivedi when TOI spoke to him on Monday, a day after he was shown the door by the UPCC’s disciplinary committee. “Why I am being punished at this age, while I had Congress in every breath of mine all my life? They can sack me from the party, but cannot get Congress out of my heart, which is full of love and respect for Indira Gandhi, Rajiv and Sonia,” said Dwivedi.

column2: SC Ayodhya verdict: Sunni waqf board to decide on land today
column3: LUCKNOW: A fortnight after the Supreme Court gave its verdict in Ayodhya title suit and allotted five-acre ‘alternative’ land to UP Sunni Central Waqf Board for construction of a mosque, the board will meet on Tuesday to discuss the order and decide on accepting the land as well as the review option. The eight-member board, including chairman Zufar Faruqi, will decide whether or not to accept the five-acre land and if it should be used to build a mosque or hospital or educational institution, if there is concurrence on taking it. Board’s chief executive officer (CEO) will also attend the meeting at its Mall Avenue office from 11am. On the seven-point agenda for the board meeting, the SC order will come up for discussion at number six — ‘court cases pertaining to the waqf board’. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Besides the chairman, the other members are advocates Imran Mabood Khan and Abdul Razzaq Khan, Abrar Ahmad, Mohammad Junaid Siddiqui, Adnan Farrukh Shah, Juneed Siddiqui and Maulana Syed Ahmed Ali alias Khushnood Miyan. Earlier, soon after SC judgment on November 9, board chairman Zufar Faruqi had announced it will not go for its review. He had added that the Sunni Waqf Board, which was the main litigant in Ayodhya case, will decide about accepting land at its November 26 meeting.However, voices of dissent arose among board members on the issue. Two of the six members TOI had contacted said there should be review of the court order as per available legal recourse. Three members also held that the board should not accept the land as there can be no barter for a mosque, which is the house of God. “The board will meet on Tuesday from 11am to discuss compliance of the SC order. The meeting should last around two hours since we will be taking up our routine agenda points as well,” chairman Zufar Faruqi told TOI on Monday. Hours before the meeting, board member Imran Mabood Khan , who holds an opposing view, expressed his inability to attend due to health reasons. Latest Commentthey have unstable mindRewardingSee All CommentsAdd comment“I have been diagnosed with dengue, so, I won’t be attending the meeting. Even attending it with a dissenting opinion won’t matter since the board decision will be of majority,” said Khan. “If I send a formal note, I know it will not be taken on record,” he added. Board members Imran and Razzaq, both advocates, are in favour of filing a review petition and not accepting alternative land.

column2: Congress purges Indira Gandhi aide who defeated a CM
column3: LUCKNOW: Ram Krishna Dwivedi, once among the most trusted men of Indira Gandhi when she was prime minister, has a remarkable achievement to his credit – he defeated a chief minister in a byelection. Today, the 87-year-old Congress veteran is out in the cold, being one of the 11 members expelled by the party on Sunday on charges of “indiscipline”. In 1971, Dwivedi had pulled off an upset win against Tribhuvan Narain Singh, contesting a byelection from Maniram Assembly constituency in Gorakhpur. “Akhir meri khata kya hai (What is my fault),” Dwivedi asked when TOI spoke to him on Monday, a day after he was shown the door by the UPCC disciplinary committee. “Why I am being punished at this age when I had Congress in every breath of mine all my life? They can sack me from the party but cannot get Congress out of my heart,” said Dwivedi

column2: Fewer companies making beeline for IIT-Madras this year
column3: CHENNAI: In yet another indication of the economic slowdown, IIT-Madras will see a 32% decline in the number of companies visiting its campus for the placement sessions beginning December 1. In 2018-19, as many as 248 companies had lined up for recruitment, which has come down to 170 this season. Some of the leading firms that visit IITs every year are likely to stay away during the placement season starting December. Many sought-after ‘Day One’ firms, which typically offer hefty packages, have either declined requests from placement cells of the institutes or are yet to confirm their interest. Asked why fewer firms had registered this time, IIT Madras said “the reasons will be addressed during Day 1 of placements”. The job profiles have also shrunk from 490 last year to 322 this time. The 322 profiles include 35 international job profiles. A total of 1,334 students have registered for placements. IIT-Madras, however, expects some good tidings as 158 students have already got job offers as against 135 last year. Some 41% of these pre-placement offers (PPOs) are for core engineering and R&D from firms including Qualcomm, Intel and Samsung Research. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.In fact, many IITs have seen a slight increase in PPOs, while some like the ones in Kanpur and Kharagpur have seen almost similar numbers. At IIT-Bombay, 163 PPOs were made till November 5, compared to 141 last year. A student representative from IIT-Delhi had earlier told TOI that many firms from the core sectors which visited last year had refused to come this year.

column2: Noida plot scam: Ex-deputy CEO faces forced exit
column3: LUCKNOW: Senior IAS officer and former Noida deputy CEO Rajiv Kumar, who was convicted and jailed for three years in the 1993 multi-crore Noida plot allotment scam, was slapped with a notice for compulsory retirement by the Uttar Pradesh government on Sunday. Kumar, who currently holds the principal secretary rank, is the youngest IAS officer of the 1983 batch and was due to retire in December. He is the first serving IAS officer in UP who faces the ignominy of being compulsorily retired for corruption. The bureaucrat was convicted by Supreme Court in 2012. He was deputy chief executive officer, Noida, when the scam unfolded under then CEO Neera Yadav, who was later elevated as chief secretary by then chief minister Mulayam Singh Yadav. Neera Yadav was charged with misusing her authority to allot two plots for her daughters while Kumar was accused of allotting one residential plot for himself in Noida. Both faced criminal charges and were convicted by the apex court. Yadav was convicted after her retirement, but Kumar faced conviction and jail while in service. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Kumar had returned his Noida plot, but was convicted for breach of trust and misuse of authority. DoPT not moved after conviction According to rules, state government has to write to the Central department of personnel and training, recommending termination of services of an IAS officer after conviction. The DoPT subsequently forwards the termination request to the President. However, in Kumar’s case, the then state government did not send a recommendation to the Centre, sources said. Additional chief secretary, personnel and appointment, Mukul Singhal, confirmed to TOI that Kumar has been served notice for compulsory retirement and an explanation has been sought from him. Latest Commentconviction is 100% exitRewardingSee All CommentsAdd commentKumar’s chances of getting any relief from SC appear to be dim as he has already been convicted and jailed by the apex court. He is also set to lose post-retirement benefits substantially. Before Kumar, another senior bureaucrat R K Sharma was sacked on corruption charge, but was later granted relief by Supreme Court. The Yogi government has been drawing Opposition flak for not acting against the big fish and punishing second-rung officers after scams. In the UPPCL scam, where Rs 2,268 provident fund is trapped with a tainted firm DHFL, the government shunted out the chairman Alok Kumar after energy minister Shrikant Sharma sought a CBI probe against him.

column2: Lucknow: Coaching centre staffer ends life, kin cry torture
column3: LUCKNOW: A 20-year-old employee of a private coaching institute in Niralanagar was found hanging inside one of the classrooms around midnight on Sunday. Police have lodged an abetment to suicide case against coaching institute owner Salil Kumar Shukla based on the complaint of deceased Ambuj Tiwari's elder brother, who has alleged that the youth was being tormented by his employer ever since Rs 1 lakh was stolen from the institute on November 20. Ambuj had been working for Shukla for the past six months. In his complaint, elder brother Ashish said Shukla and his family members accused Ambuj of stealing the cash. Ashish said they humiliated his brother to the extent that it prompted the young man to hang himself. In his statement to police, Shukla said his nephew Vaibhav and he had gone to their hometown in Hardoi and asked Ambuj to stay at the institute for security. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy."I called Ambuj a number of times on Sunday evening, but he did not answer. Concerned, I reached the institute around 11.30pm. The main door was locked from inside. I peeped through a window to find Ambuj hanging from the ceiling with a gamchha around his neck," Shukla told police. Vaibhav told TOI that they treated Ambuj like a family member. He also said that no theft had taken place and hence, no question of torture arose. Hasanganj SHO Amarnath Verma confirmed an abetment case had been lodged against both Shukla and his nephew. "We are probing the matter. The body has been sent for autopsy," he said.

column2: Ghaziabad: No guards at most ATMs, and only a few are trained
column3: GHAZIABAD: If you think the number of crimes taking place in ATMs has increased, then your concern is not unfounded as most of the counters in the city are left unattended or at the mercy of ill-equipped security guards. Exposing serious lapses in security measures on the part of many banks in Ghaziabad, police found that most of the ATMs in the city do not have any guard and the ones that do have them a majority does not carry functional guns. Powered By                          10 Sec      India orders deportation of migrants who fled Myanmar military coup	.stlp0{fill:#FF3E5F;}	.st1{fill:#fffffe;}	.st2{fill:#FF3E5F;}         .clsx-1{isolation:isolate;}.clsx-2{fill:#ff3e5f;}.clsx-3{fill:#fff;}NextStay     India orders deportation of migrants who fled Myanmar military coupNOW  PLAYINGSuez Canal Not Expected to Open Anytime SoonNOW  PLAYINGMobius Sees Turkish Lira Remaining Steady as Dollar WeakensNOW  PLAYINGIndian farmers dance to mark four months of protestsNOW  PLAYINGStuck Ship in Suez Canal Holds Up Oil and LNG ShipmentsNOW  PLAYINGBangladesh deploys border guards after deadly anti-Modi protestsNOW  PLAYINGThe secret network helping Myanmar police fleeNOW  PLAYINGBlocked Suez Forces Ships to Look at Long Trip Around AfricaNOW  PLAYINGWork to Re-Float Stuck Boat in Suez Canal SuspendedNOW  PLAYINGAt least four dead in Bangladesh Modi protestsNOW  PLAYING  Arrow Left #1 Icon Created with Sketch.                 Arrow right #1 Icon Created with Sketch.               During random inspections on Monday, the police officers found that hundreds of ATMs and banks across the city do not comply with the mandatory security measures like deployment of trained guards – some of them didn’t even know how to load a gun. Ghaziabad has 347 bank branches and over 400 ATMs. The police have now taken up the issue of security with bank authorities. The suggested measures include deployment of a minimum of four to five guards at all branches and at least one personnel at off-site ATMs, proper installation of CCTV cameras and prominent display of police helpline numbers at both banks and ATMs. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“We inspected the banks and ATMs over three days. We didn’t see a single security guard in over 200 ATMs and at some ATMs that had guards, did not have guns. Also, around 30% of the guards are over the age of 50,” a senior police officer said. Manish Kumar Mishra, SP (city) told TOI that the inspection was carried out at all the eight police station areas of the city soon after the banks opened on Monday morning. Mishra also conducted surprise checks at over 20 banks branches situated in the main markets of the city in Kotwali and expressed dissatisfaction with the security arrangements. The officer said that the banks that didn’t have proper safety measures include Bank of Baroda, Kotak Mahindra Bank and others. “The only bank that had proper security arrangements and the security guards were well trained is State Bank of India’s Navyug market branch,” added Mishra. Latest Commentch you have entered).    Step 4: At the Same time you will get 1GB Internet Data for free    Step 5: That’s It you got free 1GB 3G/4G data for free.Terms & Conditions OfVikrantSee All CommentsAdd commentPolice also issued notices to banks and security agencies and have asked for cancellation of the arms licence of the security guards who failed to load their guns. All banks have been asked to share details of guards and about cash transactions over Rs 2 lakh. “Moreover, cash vans of banks should not operate after sunset. Every cash van should be equipped with GPS, CCTV cameras and minimum two armed guards,” the SP said.

column2: Ghaziabad asked to give NHAI 20 hectares to complete DME
column3: GHAZIABAD: In order to expedite the completion of the Delhi-Meerut Expressway, the UP government has asked the district administration to give physical possession of 20 hectares of disputed land from four villages in Ghaziabad to the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) within a month. An ongoing probe into a land scam has delayed the handover of the 20 hectares needed for the completion of the 6km Dasna to Meerut stretch of the expressway. TOI has learnt that the UP government has also asked the Ghaziabad district magistrate to remove all encroachments from the disputed land in another 15 days after the handover. A meeting on the issue was also held between NHAI and Ghaziabad officials on Monday in the wake of pressure from PMO to get the issue resolved at the earliest. The district administration has also been directed to deposit compensation for the 20 hectares land to the court and apprise the state government of the developments every 15 days, sources said. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Of Rs 1,446 crore of land compensation amount deposited by NHAI, the administration has disbursed over Rs 1,300 crore so far and held up the amount for farmers of Dasna, Rasulpur-Sikrod, Nahal and Kushaliya villages after irregularities were brought to its notice. A subsequent probe by former Meerut divisional commissioner Prabhat Kumar revealed that some officials who were in the know of things before the announcement of the DME project purchased land in the name of their relatives at low rates from local farmers in 2013 and later sold the same to the state government at higher rates. The probe also indicted two former DMs, apart from other officials. Prime Minister Narendra Modi had laid the foundation stone for Delhi-Meerut Expressway project in December 2015. The acquisition of land began soon.

column2: UP: HC seeks reply on bungalow to Shivpal Singh Yadav
column3: LUCKNOW: The state government while defending the allotment of type-6 category government bungalows to four UP MLAs - Shivpal Singh Yadav, Ashish Patel, Pankaj Singh and Neeraj Bora - has told the high court that it was done as per the rules. The court has directed the government to file a counter-affidavit in this regard within two weeks. A bench of Justice PK Jaiswal and Justice Alok Mathur passed the order on a PIL seeking cancellation of the allotments. The petitioner claimed that type-6 category bungalows cannot be allotted to MLAs under the Allotment Rules .
