column2: LGBTQIA community Members get free hugs in Lucknow
column3: In order to encourage members of the LGBTQIA community, who some times suffer from identity crisis, embrace their self-identity, The Awadh Queer Pride Committee of Lucknow, in collaboration with the Kabir Festival, arranged a session of giving away free hugs to anyone attending the four-day festival. The most interesting part about this activity was that several Lucknowites at the festival came and hugged members of the LGBTQIA community, who stood there with messages like ‘I am gay, will you hug me?’ written on placards. (L) Elina and Abeer (R) Amir Raza and Sayed Raza Hussain Zaidi (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui) (L) Elina and Abeer (R) Amir Raza and Sayed Raza Hussain Zaidi (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui) One of the attendants at the festival who was seen hugging members of the LGBTQIA community with a smile said, "I think this event is the highlight of the festival. It is good to see that such activities are happening in Lucknow." Darvesh Singh Yadevendra, one of the key members of the Awadh Queer Pride Committee said, "This event basically talks about inclusivity in the society. We have made banners reading stuff like ‘I’m gay, will you hug me?’ and ‘I’m lesbian, will you hug me?’ So it’s just like hugging out differences. It’s about celebrating who you are. It delights me to see the amazing response that we are getting here." NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.(L) Darvesh Singh Yadavendra and Andrey Shah (R) Shubham and Andrew (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui) (L) Darvesh Singh Yadavendra and Andrey Shah (R) Shubham and Andrew (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui) (L) One of the community member (R) Rekha and Jatin (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui) (L) One of the community member (R) Rekha and Jatin (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui) “Being judged on the basis of who your heart beats for is very unfair I feel. Every individual should have the privilege of choosing their partner, irrespective of gender. Our event is about inclusivity. We want to spread the message of love and acceptance through our ‘Free Hug’ event,” expressed Ayushi Singh, another member of the Awadh Queer Pride. — Yashi Agarwal Vibha (L) and Shubhangi (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui) Vibha (L) and Shubhangi (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui)

column2: Sunni Waqf board won't seek Ayodhya review
column3: LUCKNOW: UP Sunni Central Waqf Board, one of the main Muslim litigants in the Ayodhya case, passed a resolution on Tuesday with a 6-1 majority against filing a petition to seek review of the Supreme Court's verdict in the case. With this, the view of board chairperson Zufar Faruqi, who has been maintaining from the day of the verdict that review petition should not be filed, has prevailed in the eight-member group. However, the board has not taken a view on whether to take the court's offer of five-acre alternative land for the construction of a mosque elsewhere in Ayodhya. Significantly, Faruqi said after the meeting that the contentious site in Ayodhya would continue to remain in the board's records. "All waqf properties, including the land where Babri Masjid stood, will continue to be in our records. There has been no decision on deleting it from records," said Faruqi. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.At the meeting, lawyer Abdul Razzaq Khan was the lone dissenter who said a review petition should be filed in the SC. Another member, Imran Mabood Khan from Allahabad, who had told the media last week that he was for filing a review petition, did not attend the board meeting citing ill health. Ihave put my dissent on record during the meeting. I maintain my stand that a review petition should be filed. On the issue of five-acre land, the board has decided to defer the matter till the government comes up with options," said Razzaq Khan. Top CommentThank you Sunni Wafq board..! You have shown a big heart..! Salute to you..! You have earned a tremendous respect from millions of us Hindus..!!Aniken See All CommentsAdd commentFaruqi said the board members sought more time to decide on the SC's offer for five-acre land. "We did not demand land and the debate was not triggered by us. A second round of deliberation will he held on the issue." Faruqi said except for the chairperson, no other board member will interact with the media. His emphasis comes days after Abdul and Imran had said ahead of the board meeting that a review plea should be filed. Besides, three members, including Abdul, Imran and Abrar Ahmed, had said last week the five-acre land offer is "unacceptable as a barter for the house of God".

column2: Kanpur: ‘Tyre puncture’ gang robs retired Army personnel of Rs 3.8 lakh
column3: KANPUR: A 42-year-old retired Army personnel became a victim of ‘tyre puncture’ gang as two motorcycle-borne men punctured one of the tyres of his motorcycle, broke open its dicky and fled with a bag containing cash worth Rs 3.8 lakh in Ghatampur area of the district on Monday. The incident took place at around 3.30 pm in front of a puncture repair shop at Ghatampur’s Jahanabad Road area. On the complaint of the Army personnel, a case under relevant sections of IPC was registered at the Ghatampur Kotwali police station. Police rushed to the spot and launched an investigation to achieve a breakthrough in the case. The Army personnel, Subhash Singh, a native of Amauli village in Sajeti in his complaint said that after withdrawing cash worth Rs 3.8 lakh from two separate banks, he went inside a cloth shop after parking his vehicle on the footpath. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“When he came out of the shop, he found one of the tyres of the bike deflated. For getting it repaired, he took the two-wheeler to a nearby puncture shop at Jahanabad road in the area. While he was busy making payment to the puncture mechanic inside the shop, the unidentified crooks broke open the dicky of the bike, picked up his bag containing cash worth Rs 3.8 lakh and fled on the bike,” the police said. Two men riding a bike were following him as he started driving from the bank, police said further. He dialed the Police Control Room and informed about the incident. He then approached the local police and filed a case. “We scanned footage of some CCTV cameras installed around the crime spot. Efforts are on to identify and nab the miscreants,” said inspector Ghatampur RB Singh.

column2: Air quality inches towards severe mark, Lucknow breathes uneasy again
column3: LUCKNOW: A blanket of smog aggravated pollution levels in the state capital on Tuesday with the air quality index (AQI) leaping 104 units in just 24 hours.  AQI in Lucknow was categorised as ‘poor’ at 273 on Monday, but it plummeted to a ‘very poor’ 377 on Tuesday. The pollution guidelines call for declaration of public health emergency once AQI breaches the ‘severe’ 400 mark. Track the pollution level in your cityLatest CommentQeyqriwtifipfisteyorupeyoeryprpputproyesgmzvmxmvxskstsfkskyyoeetiwitwtistiekgskgsmczczvmsgtketkstksgksgkzfstdufufjfRitesh kumarSee All CommentsAdd comment The worse news is that there is no relief in sight. Weathermen have forecast fog, which will mix with microscopic and harmful particulate matter to cause more smog. State Met director JP Gupta said a cyclonic circulation over Rajasthan had resulted in “clouding” over UP. Western parts of the state may also receive rain. On Tuesday, fog reduced visibility to 500 metre at 8.30am. Moderate fog during morning hours will continue in coming days. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Director of Lucknow University’s weather monitoring cell, Prof Dhruvsen Singh, said the wind speed on Tuesday was just 1.04kmph.

column2: Uttar Pradesh: 30 brokerage firms struck PCL PF deals, earned crores in commission
column3: LUCKNOW: The probe in the UPPCL PF scam has revealed that as many as 30 brokerage firms played a role in the investment of employees’ provident fund money in financial institutions other than scheduled public banks. The revelation becomes all the more alarming as senior officials said the brokerage firms got commission running into hundreds of crores. UP Police’s economic offences wing (EOW) revealed on Tuesday that total 30 brokerage firms facilitated UPPCL deals with DHFL, PNB Housing and LIC. SkipIn its investigation spanning over 24 days, EOW officials traced 30 firms, out of which 10 were ‘ghost’ firms as they only existed on papers, while nine others shut had operations before 2018. “As many as 11 firms were formed simply to take commission for facilitating deals between private firms and UPPCL,” said an officer. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.EOW sleuths have traced the bank accounts of all 30 firms in which commission amounts were credited by PNB Housing, LIC and DHFL. The officers did not disclose the total commission paid to brokerage firms, but sources said it was more than 200 crore and the figure could go up further. Sources privy to probe claimed seized documents show connivance of former UPPCL officials A P Mishra, Sudhanshu Dwivedi and P K Gupta with the 30 brokerage firms. EOW is yet to record statements of some firms and six proprietors. A senior officer privy to probe said notices have been served and statements of all proprietors will be recorded. EOW has recorded the statements of subordinates of the three arrested officials and they will be added in the chargesheets.

column2: UP govt bans drug for cardiac ailments after it fails quality test
column3: LUCKNOW: Atorvastatin, a commonly used drug for cardiac ailments supplied to over 160 government hospitals in Uttar Pradesh, failed quality parameters of the Indian Pharmacopoeia. Taking note of the same, UP State Medical Supplies Corporation has banned the medicine and ordered to recall the entire batch of drugs. “We have issued a showcause notice to the Hyderabad-based supplier firm,” said health department spokesperson, adding that arrangements were being made to provide additional stock to meet the high demand of the medicine. Such is the extent of its demand that Shyama Prasad Mukherjee Civil Hospital alone needs about 25,000 tablets of Atorvastatin every month. The annual demand jumps to three lakh units. The medicine was supplied to over 160 district hospitals besides being sent to district health offices for community health centres. Its demand can also be gauged from the fact that the number of persons with cardiac ailments heading to the government sector is increasing since the national programme to control non communicable diseases (NCD) picked up in February 2017. According to the National Health Profile, 2019, number of patients heading to the NCD clinics with cardiac ailments has gone up from 20,000 in 2017 to 28,000 in 2018. This is in addition to patients seen in the general out-patient department. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Sample of the medicine was tested by the Regional Drugs Testing Laboratory (RDTL), Chandigarh, and relevant orders were passed on November 19. Stating that the samples for testing were randomly picked up from district hospital in Agra, an official order said: “An assessment report issued by the Chandigarh lab stated that the sample does not conform to the claim as per IP in respect to dissolution and was not found to be of the standard quality.” Latest CommentSP should protest in front of Lucknow Vidhan sabhaAnkit MishraSee All CommentsAdd commentCardiac experts pointed that Atorvastatin was needed to lower bad cholesterol and fats such as triglycerides and raise good cholesterol in the blood. “The medicine belongs to a group of drugs known as statin and works by reducing the amount of cholesterol made by the liver. Its intake under medical supervision is important to prevent stroke and heart attack,” explained Prof Aditya Kapoor, faculty, department of cardiology, Sanjay Gandhi Post Graduate Institute of Medical Sciences.

column2: Harmony after Ayodhya verdict proves strength of democracy: Yogi Adityanath
column3: LUCKNOW: Chief minister Yogi Adityanath said the fact that no untoward incident took place after the Supreme Court gave verdict in favour of the construction of Ram temple in Ayodhya, and communal harmony prevailed, demonstrates the strength of democracy. Speaking on the floor of the House on Tuesday, Yogi said, “People questioned me about law and order being under threat after the SC verdict, but said nothing would happen.” “Strength of democracy was witnessed on November 9 when all sections accepted the verdict,” Yogi said, praising SC for delivering a verdict that resolved the decades-old dispute. Yogi also invoked B R Ambedkar, saying the father of Indian Constitution always opposed Article 370 that gave special status to Jammu and Kashmir. “He saw it as a challenge and stood against the provision. Ambedkar ji said the article would be abrogated by a government having strength and courage. That strength and courage was shown by PM Narendra Modi and home minister Amit Shah,” he said. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“Today Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh are on way to prosperity. Modi and Shah carried forward the objectives of Vallabhbhai Patel who brought together various princely states,” he said.Yogi said the special session is a tribute to Ambedkar and other leaders who drafted the Constitution. “It is a good occasion to remember the objectives of Constitution. The preamble ensures justice for all, freedom for all, and equality and fraternity for national unity. This is the soul of the Constitution,” he said. Slamming Congress for abstaining, Yogi said, “It shows they don’t respect the Constitution. For them only power is important.” Latest Commentok ok yogi jiAnkit MishraSee All CommentsAdd comment“People have seen five years of BJP government at Centre, but those who practiced nepotism are now giving us lectures on socialism. Those using Dalits as vote bank stopped scholarships for them in 2016, we restarted the scholarships,” he said, taking a swipe at SP and BSP. “All the welfare schemes were implemented without any caste or religion bias. We provided benefits of schemes to all the needy,” he said, adding his government was committed to Sabka Sath Sabka Vikas, Sabka Vishwas.

column2: Opposition finds Maharashtra agenda in UP assembly to target govt
column3: LUCKNOW: The vacillating turn of events in Maharashtra politics reverberated in UP assembly on Tuesday with the Opposition accusing BJP of violating constitutional provisions by getting Devendra Fadnavis sworn in as chief minister even though he did not have majority. Speaking during the special session, Leader of Opposition Ram Govind Chaudhary demanded a white paper on the developments in Maharashtra before President’s rule was revoked and Fadnavis took oath. BSP legislative party leader Lalji Verma echoed Chaudhary’s views, saying what transpired in Maharashtra was gross violation of constitutional norms. “A cabinet meeting was called clandestinely to revoke President’s rule and BJP leader was sworn in as CM. In all this, Constitution was violated,” he said, even though no meeting of Union cabinet was held and PM had used his special powers under Rule 12 of Transaction of Business Rules. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Verma said Constitution Day is being observed to divert people’s attention from burning issues. “Be it employment or bringing back black money, BJP failed on all fronts,” he said. Accusing BJP of harbouring corrupt politicians, Verma said the saffron party thinks it’s a holy river where sins of corrupt are washed away. He also accused BJP of being casteist and looking down upon people of low caste. “A groom of low caste cannot ride a horse in BJP regime. This shows the mindset of right-wing forces,” he said. He also accused BJP of not complying with Supreme Court order that allowed entry of women in Sabarimala temple. “Are we ensuring equality among people,” he asked, while reading out constitutional provisions in this regard. Verma said people from minority community like Pehlu Khan are being killed by right wing forces. He also accused BJP of misusing constitutional agencies like CBI. “I don’t want to take names of agencies, but they are in absolute control of government,” he said.

column2: Uttar Pradesh assembly: Speaker douses flare-up between opposition leader & minister
column3: LUCKNOW: The timely intervention of speaker Hriday Narayan Dikshit averted an unpleasant situation during the debate in Assembly on Constitution Day, as parliamentary affairs minister Suresh Khanna and Leader of Opposition Ram Govind Chaudhary entered into a verbal duel. As soon as Khanna tabled the motion on discussion on Preamble to the Constitution and Article 51(A) enshrining duties of citizens, Chaudhary raised the political turn of events in Maharashtra and accused governor Bhagat Singh Koshiyari of allowing government formation through backdoor. As Chaudhary continued to criticise Koshiyari, Khanna challenged him, saying the house does not have the right to discuss or criticise role of governors. “What you are speaking is unconstitutional and the Speaker is requested to expunge the words of the Leader of Opposition,” said Khanna. Chaudhary retaliated, saying he was not discussing the role of governor, but how the spirit of Constitution was trampled by Koshiyari. “Even this is not allowed,” said a combative Khanna. “I am discussing the Constitution only,” retorted Chaudhary and the duo engaged in a heated argument, but Dikshit promptly intervened and asked them to sit down. Dikshit told Chaudhary, the Constitution does not permit state assemblies to criticise the role of governor and it was not a healthy practice and tradition. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.He also quoted constitutional provisions and practices to convince him to change the course of his speech and revert to constitutional provisions. Chaudhary then resumed his address, without making further mention of Koshiyari.

column2: PM Narendra Modi brought J&K on par with other states: UP governor Anandiben Patel
column3: LUCKNOW: Terming abrogation of the provisions of Article 370 and Article 35A as historic, UP governor Anandiben Patel on Tuesday hailed Prime Minister Narendra Modi for bringing Jammu & Kashmir on par with other states. Addressing her first joint session of the state legislature convened by chief minister Yogi Adityanath on Constitution Day, the governor said: “After the abrogation of Article 370 in Jammu & Kashmir, same laws will be applicable in the entire country. The dream of one constitution, one flag and one nation has been fulfilled.” Unlike her predecessor Ram Naik, who used to have longer speeches, Anandiben chose to keep her address brief completing in just 15 minutes. Highlighting the achievements of the Yogi Adityanath government, she said: “In last two years, the state government has built 25 lakh houses for the poor, planted 24 crore saplings and declared all 75 districts ODF by constructing 2.61 crore toilets.” NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.She said all citizens should be made aware of their duties enshrined in the Constitution which could become a reality after lakhs of people sacrificed their lives fighting for the country’s independence. Unlike addresses by previous governors in the state assembly, the opposition heard Anandiben’s speech with rapt attention.

column2: Uttar Pradesh: BJP talks of Ram Rajya, but commits gravest sins, says Ram Govind Chaudhary
column3: LUCKNOW: Leader of Opposition Ram Govind Chaudhary targeted BJP saying it makes lofty claims of working to ensure Ram Rajya in state but commits gravest crimes and sins. Speaking in UP assembly on Tuesday, Chaudhary further alleged that the Yogi government is involved in corruption and scandals and lathicharges people when they oppose it. The government unleashes CBI, ED and other law-enforcing agencies to muzzle the voice of those who oppose its bad policies and hence it has no right to call a special session on Constitution Day, he added. “BJP murdered democracy in a mid-night coup in Maharashtra. It has been conspiring to grab power through backdoor and defiled the sanctity and spirit of Constitution by involving the highest constitutional offices in late night machinations in Bihar, Karnataka,Goa and Maharashtra,” said Chaudhary. “The government holds specials sessions just to grab newspaper headlines. It should do concrete work for welfare of people and state and shed practice of trying to grab media space,” he added.

column2: Dalit molested: Hospital general manager, 11 others booked in Uttar Pradesh
column3: LUCKNOW: An FIR has been registered against the general manager, manager and 10 employees of an Amethi hospital for allegedly outraging the modesty of a 45-year-old Dalit worker. The hospital is managed by Sanjay Gandhi Memorial Trust from Delhi and has affiliation to a national political party. Munshiganj police is yet to record statements in the case. Latest CommentNice article so cool but very bad sarkar to yogiArvind kumarSee All CommentsAdd commentThe woman, in her FIR, alleged that she had gone to file a complaint of sexual harassment of her colleague against hospital general manager Bholanath Tiwari. “When Tiwari came to know that I had accompanied my colleague to the police station, he came to my residence along with manager Awadesh Tiwari, supervisors Raj Bahadur Singh, Rizwan and five others in the wee hours on Tuesday. First, they broke the door open and then hurled abuses,” she said. “When I tried to inform the police, they snatched my mobile and tried to outrage my modesty,” she added. Later, the accused fled after issuing a warning. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.

column2: Uttar Pradesh: After purge of old guard, Congress plea to disqualify Aditi Singh
column3: LUCKNOW: Days after purging the party of 10 rebels in the old guard, Congress on Tuesday filed a petition for disqualification of its GenNext leader, Aditi Singh, who recently married a Punjab Congress MLA Angad Saini. The representation was filed by Congress legislature party leader Aradhana Mishra Mona before Vidhan Sabha Speaker Hriday Narayan Dikshit. According to the application, Rae Bareli Sadar MLA Aditi Singh had defied party’s whip to boycott the special session organized by the UP government to mark 150th birth anniversary celebrations of Mahatma Gandhi. “Her sudden appearance in the special session was the first trigger. She has been indulging in activities that are not in line with party’s principles,” said a senior leader. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.On October 2, Aditi skipped ‘Shanti Yatra’, led by party national general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, to attend the special assembly session convened by the UP government. The next day, Aditi’s demand for security enhancement, which was pending since June following an attack on her, was fulfilled by the Yogi government. Her meeting with UP chief minister Yogi Adityanath on October 16 also sparked speculations of her exit from the party. Aditi, however, dismissed it as a routine visit about development projects in her constituency. She had also skipped a party training session in Rae Bareli between October 22 and 24.

column2: Graft case: CBI court summons ex-HC judge
column3: NEW DELHI: A special CBI court on Tuesday took cognisance of the chargesheet filed against retired Odisha high court judge IM Quddusi and six others for allegedly conspiring to "settle" a case involving a private medical college in Lucknow that had been debarred from operating. The court issued summons to all seven for the next hearing on January 9. "I am of the considered opinion that there is sufficient material to take cognisance of the offence. Accordingly, I take cognisance of the offence, as detailed in the chargesheet," special judge Anil Kumar Sisodia said. SkipBesides the former judge, the CBI has accused Bhawna Pandey, Bhagwan Prasad Yadav, Palash Yadav, Sudhir Giri, Bishwanath Agarwala and Ram Dev Saraswat of corruption and criminal conspiracy. The CBI has alleged that Quddusi, in collusion with the other accused, not only "guided" the functionaries of the private medical college but also assured them of a favourable judicial settlement. Advocate Vijay Aggarwal, who is representing Quddusi and the other accused, accused the agency of "adding few bits here and few bits there". NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.He said the charges "would not stand the test of judicial scrutiny". The CBI had carried out raids in Bhubaneswar, Lucknow and Delhi, including at the Greater Kailash residence of Quddusi. Also on the agency's radar was a hawala dealer from whom Rs 1 crore had been allegedly collected to bribe government servants in Delhi. Prasad Institute of Medical College was among the 46 colleges barred by the government from admitting medical students because they did not fulfil the requisite criteria, including infrastructure and other facilities for students. The owners of the institute challenged the order in the Supreme Court in 2017. On August 1 that year, the apex court directed the government to consider afresh the material on record pertaining to the case. A hearing was given to the college by the government before deciding to debar the college from admitting students for the 2017-18 and 2018-19 sessions. The government also authorised the Medical Council of India to encash the bank guarantee of Rs 2 crore. The CBI received information that Bhagwan Prasad, who owns the institute, allegedly got in touch with Quddusi and Pandey through co-accused Giri and conspired to get the matter settled.

column2: Ayodhya order: Sunni Waqf Board won't go for review
column3: LUCKNOW: UP Sunni Central Waqf Board reiterated its decision to not seek a review of the Ayodhya verdict after a crucial meeting in Lucknow on Tuesday. The board also deferred its decision on accepting 5 acre allotted by Supreme Court for construction of a mosque. Board chairperson, however, said the site will continue to be on waqf record as the property of Sunni Board. Seven members, including chairperson Zufar Faruqi, attended the meeting, while one member, Imran Mabood Khan of Allahabad, abstained citing ill health. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Ahead of the meeting, two members Imran Mabood and Abdul Razzaq Khan had expressed dissent and sought review of the Supreme Court verdict. And on Tuesday, Razzak Khan stuck to his stand. Talking to reporters after the meeting, Waqf Board chief Zufar Faruqi said a majoritarian resolution of not filing a review was passed by the board on Tuesday, which was also the board’s stand since November 9, when the judgment was delivered. Razzak sole dissenting voice in BoardBoard member and advocate Abdul Razzaq Khan voiced his opposition and wanted a review of the verdict. However, majority view was that Supreme Court verdict should be accepted. No decision has been taken on the 5-acre alternative land mandated by apex court as members sought more time. We did not demand land and the debate was not triggered by us. We will comply with Supreme Court order and a second round of deliberation will he held on the alternative land issue,” said Faruqi. Talking to reporters after the board meeting, advocate Abdul Razzaq Khan said, “I have put my dissent on record. The board decided not to file a review petition, but I maintain my stand that a review should be filed. On the 5-acre land, the board has decided to defer the matter till the government comes up with options." Latest Commentat hair prep wiqrisfksgkdgmmxvmxvmzcnzgmzgmtkstke kwtkstkeyldykstetketketkstkdgksgjsfjwtixhldtieyietiwtistkeyieufyeRitesh kumarSee All CommentsAdd commentFaruqi also said no member of the board except the chairperson will interact with media. This came after two members — Imran Mabood Khan and Abdul Razzaq Khan — expressed dissenting views, days before the meeting. Earlier, at least three members had told media the 5 acre alternative is unacceptable as a barter for house of God. Faruqi, however, added that “all waqf properties, including Babri Masjid will continue to be on our records. There has been no decision to delete it.” Sunni Waqf Board is not the sole Muslim litigant in the Ayodhya suit. The All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) which had been backing litigants has support of six Muslim litigants for filing a review. The Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind, another key Muslim litigant, has also decided to file a review on SC’s order. Of total 10 Muslim litigants, seven parties have decided to file for review. Those not filing a petition include UP Sunni Central Waqf Board, UP Shia Central Waqf board and Iqbal Ansari.

column2: Every penny of UPPCL staff PF will be recovered: Yogi Adityanath
column3: LUCKNOW: Chief minister Yogi Adityanath gave assurance in the legislative council saying each and every penny of UP Power Corporation Limited (UPPCL) employees will be recovered and given to them. Speaking in the Vidhan Parishad on Tuesday, the CM said, "Kisi bhi karamchari ke saath kutharaghat nahin hone denge, aur power corporation ne bhi kaha hai ki karamchariyon ke PF ki ek ek pai lenge. Jo bhi uss ghotale mein lipt hoga, uski poori sampatti zapt kar ke, ek ek karamchari ki pai pai lautane ka kaam karenge (We will not allow any loss to the employees. Even the power corporation has said that each and every penny of PF will be recovered. We will confiscate all the property of those involved in the scam and will return the money of every employee)." CM: PF scam had roots in Akhilesh govtLatest CommentRight under his nose how money of employees were allowed to swindle by vested interests?Sheik MohamedSee All CommentsAdd commentBlaming the previous government for the scam while apparently referring to former UPPCL MD A P Mishra, Yogi said: “The PF scam started in December 2016. The then MD was getting extension after extension without cabinet nod. He was the favourite of previous SP government and mastermind of the scam,” the CM said, adding that the officer was now in jail and the government would ensure that no employee loses any money. This is the first time that the CM has spoken about the PF scam, though the government has assured financial back up to UPPCL for paying the provident fund invested in tainted firm DHFL. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.The PF scam which rocked the state has seen the arrest of three UPPCL senior officers, including former MD A P Mishra.

column2: Lucknow: Speeding four-wheeler drags, crushes elderly
column3: LUCKNOW: In yet another hit-and-run case, a 60-year-old woman was mowed down by a speeding vehicle in Malihabad on Tuesday. This year, 12 hit-and-run cases have been reported which have claimed 14 lives. Station house officer, Malihabad, Siyaram said, “Shanti Devi (60) of Sirawa village in Malihabad was going on foot to purchase milk from a shop at 10.30 am. As she reached the main Malihabad road, an unidentified vehicle coming from Tehsil side crushed her.” NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Shanti’s body got entangled in the vehicle’s bumper and got dragged for about 750 metres before hitting a divider. Some passers-by tried to chase the vehicle but the driver managed to flee. Locals rushed the critically injured woman to community health centre in Malihabad where she was pronounced dead on arrival. Her husband, Shiv Nandan, owns a general store. Latest Commentpeople walk in space meant for vehiclesRewardingSee All CommentsAdd comment“An FIR has been lodged against the unidentified driver on charges of causing death by negligence and rash driving. CCTVs installed in the area are being scanned to trace the vehicle,” the SHO said. A resident of the area said: “Police have not been able to rein in speeding drivers. Malihabad road is very risky but neither a sign board has been installed nor the authorities have laid speed breakers.”

column2: India has benefited from Constitution unlike Pakistan, says Allahabad high court Chief Justice Govind Mathur
column3: LUCKNOW: Allahabad high court Chief Justice Govind Mathur on Tuesday exhorted judicial officers and legal luminaries to follow the Constitution like "Gita". The chief justice said judges and lawyers should work together to make the Constitution functional. Powered By                          10 Sec      Bangladesh deploys border guards after deadly anti-Modi protests	.stlp0{fill:#FF3E5F;}	.st1{fill:#fffffe;}	.st2{fill:#FF3E5F;}         .clsx-1{isolation:isolate;}.clsx-2{fill:#ff3e5f;}.clsx-3{fill:#fff;}NextStay     Bangladesh deploys border guards after deadly anti-Modi protestsNOW  PLAYINGThe secret network helping Myanmar police fleeNOW  PLAYINGBlocked Suez Forces Ships to Look at Long Trip Around AfricaNOW  PLAYINGIndia tells overseas vaccine buyers it must prioritise local needNOW  PLAYINGIndian farmers dance to mark four months of protestsNOW  PLAYINGSuez Canal Not Expected to Open Anytime SoonNOW  PLAYINGAt least four dead in Bangladesh Modi protestsNOW  PLAYINGStuck Ship in Suez Canal Holds Up Oil and LNG ShipmentsNOW  PLAYINGWork to Re-Float Stuck Boat in Suez Canal SuspendedNOW  PLAYINGIndia orders deportation of migrants who fled Myanmar military coupNOW  PLAYING  Arrow Left #1 Icon Created with Sketch.                 Arrow right #1 Icon Created with Sketch.               Pointing towards Pakistan, Justice Mathur said: "Within span of few hours, two countries including India adopted the Constitution, but our neighbour is a failed state while we stand tall. It is because of the people of the country and the concepts enshrined in our Constitution which talk about social, economic and political justice as well as liberty, equality and fraternity."  Chief Justice Govind Mathur was addressing judges, senior advocates, judicial officers, state law officers and trainee judges at an event organised by the high court on the occasion of Constitution Day on Tuesday . NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Speaking on the topic 'Development of India as a nation and our Constitutional values', he said that, "Our neighbour has not benefited from the Constitution and many top military officers took over the reigns of the government and even became the president of Pakistan. We cannot even think of this in our country because the members of our constituent assembly had worked on its each and every aspect."

column2: Lucknow: Facebook friend 'from UK' cons businessman of Rs 4 lakh
column3: LUCKNOW: A city businessman has allegedly been swindled out of Rs 4.66 lakh by a woman he befriended on Facebook a few months ago. According to the FIR lodged on Tuesday, Gomtinagar extension resident Abhay Raj Singh received and accepted a friend request from one Isabella Greene of the UK in July. They first began chatting on Facebook Messenger and later on WhatsApp. "She introduced herself as a UK citizen and told me she was visiting India. She showed me her London-Mumbai air ticket and promised to visit Lucknow to meet me," Singh said in his complaint to police. On Saturday, the businessman got a call from another woman who identified herself as customs officer Vishakha in Mumbai. Latest CommentFlight leke mumbai chala jaats 2 ghante mein...What a foolAkhil JaisinghSee All CommentsAdd comment"I was told that Isabella was carrying a lot of jewellery, but had no cash to pay the customs fee of Rs 4.66 lakh. After Vishakha, I spoke to Isabella who promised to pay me back once she reached Lucknow," the complainant said. Once he transferred the money, Isabella switched off her phone and so did the other woman. On Sunday, Isabella's Facebook profile was also deactivated. Singh contacted his sources in Mumbai and learnt there was no woman named Vishakha working for the customs either. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Gomtinagar SHO Amit Dubey said investigations had begun and police were trying to track down the two phone numbers used by the women.

column2: Congressmen missing, they've no respect for statute: Yogi Adityanath
column3: LUCKNOW: CM Adityanath Yogi slammed Congress party for abstaining from the special session convened to mark the Constitution Day, saying, "It shows they don't respect the Constitution. For them only power is important." "Today Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh are on way to prosperity. Modi and Shah carried forward the dream of Vallabhbhai Patel who integrated princely states," he said. Yogi said the special session is a tribute to B R Ambedkar and other leaders who drafted the Constitution. "It is a good occasion to remember the objectives of Constitution. The preamble ensures justice for all, freedom for all, and equality and fraternity for national unity. This is the soul of the Constitution," he said. "People have seen BJP government at Centre, but those who practiced nepotism are now giving us lectures on socialism. Those using Dalits as vote bank stopped scholarships for them in 2016, we restarted them," he said, taking a swipe at SP and BSP. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy."All welfare schemes were implemented without any bias. We provided benefits of schemes to all the needy," he said, adding his government was committed to Sabka Sath Sabka Vikas, Sabka Vishwas.

column2: In two months, 44 hit by dengue in Noida, 93 in Ghaziabad
column3: NOIDA: Over 40 confirmed dengue cases have been reported from Gautam Budh Nagar in the past two months. The figure (44) is almost double of last year’s tally of 27 cases recorded around the same time. In the past couple months, from mid-September to mid-November, the number of suspected dengue cases stands at 221. Ghaziabad recorded 93 confirmed cases so far, officials said. Last year the figure was 64 around the same time. In Noida, officials said awareness and inspection drives are being conducted, along with district health department’s vector-borne communicable disease control drive that started from November 16 and continue till the end of the month. “So far, 44 cases of dengue have been reported in Gautam Budh Nagar. Most are from Chhapraula village in Dadri, Nithari and Barola. Besides, 221 cases are under scanner,” said Dr Anurag Bhargava, the chief medical officer (CMO), GB Nagar. Shruti KC Verma, the assistant malaria officer, GB Nagar said: “While last year, confirmed dengue cases were 27, this year, the number has gone up to 44. It’s mostly because people do not adhere to precautionary measures, despite being apprised of such steps. Ghaziabad has reported more cases this time. The figure is also more from last year’s 64.” NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Speaking about the vector-borne disease drive, Dr Bhargava said: “While awareness drive is being held, regular checking, blood filming, anti-larva sprays to fogging etc. are also being carried out.” On Tuesday, GB Nagar magistrate BN Singh issued an advisory for people staying in the areas that have reported confirmed dengue cases stating that all precautions, like wearing full-sleeve clothes, keeping surroundings clean and sanitised, and not allowing retention of water in any container, should be taken. Cleaning of fridge trays and using of disinfectants and sprays have been advised. “In the past, potential and confirmed dengue patients were found in sectors 73, 82, 46, 15, 12, 93, 44 and Chhlera, Nithari, Harola and Khanpur. Since Aedes mosquito bites during the day, people are advised to wear full-sleeved dresses, pyjamas and socks. Use mosquito repellents while resting during the day and nets during the night. Do not allow water to get collected in and around homes. Keep cooler tanks dry and empty. In case there are dengue-like symptoms, one should report to the district hospital and get free treatment,” the district health department advisory says.

column2: Delhi-Meerut Rapid Rail to get land from govt agencies
column3: GHAZIABAD: The National Capital Region Transport Corporation (NCRTC), the agency tasked with building the Delhi-Meerut Rapid Rail Transit System (RRTS), will get 15 hectares of government land parcels along the route proposed for the corridor. This was discussed at a meeting headed by divisional commissioner Anita Meshram on Tuesday and a proposal on the valuation of the land patches would soon be sent to the state government for approval. The 15 hectares are in patches and belong to several government agencies like Ghaziabad Development Authority, Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation, irrigation department and UPSRTC. The departments concerned have been instructed to expedite the process of transferring the land, which would be used to build stations. Skip“The agencies are done with their valuation of land in consultation with NCRTC. It’ll be sent to the government for final approval,” Meshram said after the meeting. “There are 15 hectares with various agencies. Efforts are on so that the land is available with NCRTC at the earliest,” she added. Latest Commentnd enter your AirTel Number Verify By OTP.    Now Click on Apps in my Airtel App , Now download Airtel tv app    Open and register in airtel tv app.    Bingo ! You get 500 MB - 10 GB f...Read MoreVikrantSee All CommentsAdd commentWhile one part of the land deck has been cleared for NCRTC, another demand of 4,000sqm for building a substation has hit hurdle. “We will have to scout for another piece of land for the sub-station. GMC has informed us that the plot concerned is categorised as forest land and cannot be given to NCRTC,” Meshram said. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.NCRTC was also said to have informed the divisional commissioner that 8 of 17 transmission lines have been shifted for building the corridor. The priority section of the 82km corridor is a 17km stretch between Sahibabad and Duhai. All along the alignment, 100 foundations have been laid and work on piers and viaduct has started. “We plan to commission the priority section by March 2023,” an NCRTC official said.

column2: Shilpa Shetty begins shooting for her next in Lucknow
column3: Shilpa Shetty arrived in Lucknow on Tuesday evening to shoot for the second schedule of her upcoming film Nikamaa. Shilpa, who will be seen in a movie after a long time, will be essaying the role of Avni in the film. She will be joining Bhagyashree’s son, Mard Ko Dard Nahi Hota actor Abhimanyu Dassani and singer Shirley Setia, who have been shooting in the city, with director Sabbir Khan. Shilpa will be shooting some scenes of the movie near Clock Tower in old Lucknow. Actor Sameer Soni too will be joining the cast of the film from today. -Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui

column2: The biggest stamp of approval from my parents came after the Filmfare award: Costume designer Rohit Chaturvedi
column3: Little did Kanpur-born Rohit Chaturvedi knew what fate had in store for him. A studious teenager, who went to Mumbai to become a Chartered Accountant, is today a well-known costume designer in Bollywood. In Lucknow for the movie Pagglait which features Sanya Malhotra in lead, Rohit talked with us about his journey from Kanpur to Mumbai, his first big break, his Filmfare award and more... "I was born and brought in Kidwai Nagar in Kanpur. I grew up there but I was there only till the age of 15. I had topped my board exams then from the commerce field, so my dad was like since you are good in studies, I will send you to Mumbai, as my sister was already studying there. Bollywood happened by chance,” says Rohit, who has also designed costumes for the movie Uri: The Surgical Strike. “I was doing some random styling for my college fests when friend’s mom saw me styling the costumes and she came up to me with an offer that her friend had a production house where they needed a stylist for a TV show. At that time I didn’t tell my parents about this. It was only after I did six TV shows for the production house that I told my mom and dad about all this." Rohit with SRK at the Filmfare (BCCL) Rohit with SRK at the Filmfare (BCCL) He adds, "I told them that aapka beta jo CA banne waala tha ab styling karega. While my mom was pretty okay with this as she always knew that I would land up doing something hatt ke, my dad was shocked. But the journey had already started. My first proper celebrity styling was for the celebs who featured on the show The Great Indian Comedy Show. I did styling for celebs like Suchitra Pillai, Ranveer Shorey, among others. I also did costumes for a few music albums." NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Telling us about the turning point in his career, Rohit says, "However, the game changer was when I got a call from Ram Gopal Varma, who wanted me to design costumes for a few songs for his film Darna Zaroori Hai, which was my first feature film. While I was shooting for the song, he asked me if I would like to do the costumes for his next film Shiva. But the interesting part is that though I had done more than 25 films, the stamp of approval for my parents came after the Filmfare award which I won last year for Konkona Sen Sharma’s A Death In The Gunj. They always wanted me to win an award like a Filmfare, they wanted that validation more than me wishing for it." So how was it winning your first Filmfare award? "I was shivering holding that black lady in my hand; it is the best feeling in the world. We are a very external looking industry, so an award like Filmfare does matter and yes it changes people’s perception towards the person. People who are close to me, for them nothing has changed but yes for a lot of other people, they look at me in a different manner now. Somebody giving you a little more respect, well, that is how I look at it. The best part of it is that someone like me is getting a Filmfare for Best Costume category, who doesn’t have a degree in Fashion," says Rohit. So does a degree in fashion matters then? "Well, today a lot of fashion students come to me as interns, you know not that I am undermining education at all, it is very very important, but you can’t cultivate that germ in you if you don’t have it. Somebody can give you a degree but nobody can give you the talent to survive with that degree. I never really felt that lack of having a fashion degree," he shares. Rohit Chaturvedi (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) Rohit Chaturvedi (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) Ask him about his days spent in Kanpur and he says, "My family has not shifted to Mumbai with me. I was in Kanpur a really long time ago some 14 years, I guess. But I seriously wish to go back there soon. I have so many fond memories of my hometown. I have studied in UP Kirana Seva Samiti Vidyalaya Public School in Kanpur. I am still in touch with the principal of my school of my time, Renuka Gulati. After I won the Filmfare award, a lot of my teachers got in touch with me on Facebook and we are back in touch now. I miss Kanpur ki Tewari Ki Chaat on Birhana road and the laddoos the most." Rohit feels that as a costumer designer of a film, it isn’t that difficult for him to make clothes for them if he has earned their trust. “Makeup and costumes are so personal to celebrities that you can’t externally look at it and say they are easy. You have to earn their trust. An artist is the face of the medium or a film and is the most insecure, as well. They are very particular about who they are getting designed by. I have worked with the ‘so-called’ difficult celebrities but they were not difficult with me. We do take inputs from actors but how much of it we incorporate them is upto us. But you have to give their opinion a validation,” he says. After the film Manjunath, where the characters were from Lucknow, this is Rohit’s second film in which he will be designing costumes for Lakhnawi characters. “Lucknowites’ dressing is very interesting. Though the dressing has evolved of UPites, we still have a rawness in our dressing style which people will get to see in Pagglait. Giving you a small example, women here used to wear woollen blouses with saris in winters and since our film is set in the winter season you will get to see such small small detailing in the actor’s clothes,” smiles Rohit.
